So even though it did not fit exactly the rule the steep slope of the BB would have helped you on that decision.

--- 帖子 #11 ---
for everyone info , the red line is not fixed. It moves as u drag the chart, take note if u wanna do visual backtest. Which means if u see the red line on 85/15 now , it might not be on 85/15 if it continue to trend and the red line will move away from 85/15 as it trend. When it finally stop and reverse , it will then stay on 85/15

- trade only with the overall trend

- one with a SL of 300, one re-entry after 200pips at 1.5x

- for quicker ones, 500SL, one re-entry after 300pips, 1.3x

--- 帖子 #15 ---
There are two tools in the indicators section I gave but did not talk about. I is the support and resistance indicator and the other is 1 week pivot indicator. By clicking on the little magnifying glass and increasing your vision to 8 weeks you can connect the dots and see very important support and resistance lines Here is one for the Aud/Jpy and why I think it is a good sell trade. I put two gold lines where this key resistance area is located. You can manually trade these areas instead of the EA and use a stop loss if the line is broken. Look at this pic below to see what I mean.

The second pic is a 1 week pivot indicator and it shows key pivot, resistance, and support levels based on weekly data. You can see here that it shows the Aud/jpy could move south to the next support level first before turning around  or it is at the turn around point.

You can place buys or sells at these lines to get the best possible entrances on the trades. So you dont have to use the EA to place your trades, you can enter off of support and resistance lines instead. You can use buy limit sell limit or buy stop or sell stop orders to trade. But this shows you ways on how to trade this system.

--- 帖子 #16 ---

--- 帖子 #17 ---
There is a thread somewhere in FF that talks about the differences. Mainly the MT4 one is smoother and doesnt go as high or low as a True MACD. Also a True MACD has two lines and a histogram while the MT4  only uses one line and a histogram. We only use the line in this system.

--- 帖子 #18 ---
Bob, I commend you for all your work.

This looks like a great system. I can't wait to try it out.

I have an observation and a constructive suggestion.

The MACD line doesn't really work, when superimposed on the stochastics.

It's position, over 85 or under 15, is by pure chance and is caused by the way MT4 positions it on the screen.

MT4 fits the MACD on the screen so that it's highest point and lowest point are equidistant from the top of the window and bottom of the window. If it happens to fall over or under certain Stochastic levels, it's a coincidence.

Here's a couple of screen shots to show you what I mean.

The yellow vertical line is at exactly the same data point on both shots.

Notice on the first one, the MACD is below 15.

On the second one, it is in the middle of the window.

The only difference is that I moved the chart back.

The Stochastics do not move in relation to the 85 and 15 line, because these levels are stochastic levels.

In my next post, I will offer a solution for you to consider.

--- 帖子 #19 ---
Here's what I think is the solution.

The first indicator is your MACD. I have removed the stochastics for clarity. It is Red.

The second indicator is a 26/12/9 %D Stochastic. It is Yellow.

The shapes are almost identical.

The difference is that the Stochastic is always stable in relationship to the 85 and 15. It doesn't reposition itself as the screen shifts.

--- 帖子 #24 ---
yeh i know but what im trying to say, and what is explained as 'the one weakness' is that the macd position today wont look the same 3 weeks from now looking back... cos we arent trading back in time it doesnt matter, we aree trading at the right edge and we take its signal from the right edge position

--- 帖子 #25 ---
The MACD placement is just as arbitrary and random on the right edge of the screen as it is any other part of the screen.

It is not tied to the stochastic levels. The stochastics are related to those levels because they are stochastic levels, they are not MACD levels.

The MACD is fitted onto the screen, to make it's highest point the same distance from the top of the pane as it's lowest point is from the bottom of the pane.

If it coincides with 15 or 85, it's pure accident.

--- 帖子 #26 ---
Here's another example.

The first screenshot shows the Red MACD line well below the 15 (My yellow vertical line)

The second screenshot is the same thing, except I've merely zoomed out a notch.

At my yellow vertical line (same location as in the first shot), the MACD is almost half way up the scale.

The thing is not stable. The MACD 15 and 85  readings, you are using are illusions.

They are caused by MT4 trying to center the screen and fill it up. They have no relationship to what the MACD is actually doing.

--- 帖子 #27 ---
The MACD shift is not that big of a problem on a 4H chart because by the time it starts shifting you are days down the road and the trade is usually done by then. Remember from one line to the next is a week and if you see the shift in the next week your 5 days past the trade. Also notice the white line moved up and the blue line did not. With the bounce off of the 20 MA you know not to stay in the trade. It would still have been a profitable trade but a small one at that. The white line will give you a warning of the MACD shift because the blue does not go with it. That is the improvement I have over the previous version we had tried last year. This then could have been taken as a trend continuation trade. It also would have been a small profit or break even. The time frame of this trade your showing is about 36 hours, 9 bars. There is plenty of time to react. Also you dont have a clear cut move off of the BB bottom line, some trades will go sideways and there is not much there but either way there is no big loss here. I see you have a sell on this trade and am heading for trouble.

One last comment you dont have all the parameters of the trade. The red, white and blue are not bunch together below the 15 at the same time, they are spread out plus you are not at he bottom of the BB, so this is a very weak read of my system.

--- 帖子 #28 ---
Bob,

The MACD line is serving absolutely no purpose.

If you don't see that by now, it's my fault for not being able to adequately explain it.

The shift you are talking about is not a shift from accurate to inaccurate. It is never accurate to begin with, in its relationship to the stochastics and their levels.

Trying to superimpose unlike indicators and using the levels of one for the other, is a common mistake.

It does not work.

I'll leave it alone. I've given it my best shot

--- 帖子 #32 ---
To recap...

--- 帖子 #33 ---
The idea of the floating MACD is based on where it is at now. What it does after now, 1 week ago, 2 weeks ago, 3 weeks ago matters little. We dont need that information. MACD a lagging indicator does not move quickly with price so it stays steady until price has clearly changed but then its read is to slow in a ranging market. It is not a good indicator when price  is ranging. The sto is a great ranging indicator but horrible in trending markets. They both have strengths and weaknesses. If you combine them they help overcome each others weakness by using their strengths. If price is trending strongly the sto lines will stay on one side of the MACD. If there is a retracement in the trend the white will go with it, while MACD will move very little or none, and the blue sto may move a little. This is the MACD strength and using the Sto weakness to indicate trend is continuing. This will be confirmed by the 20MA in the BB. So the Sto weakness on its own becomes a strength in connection with the MACD. We see the quick reacting sto giving us a false signal but the blue and red staying steady so we continue with the trend. This weakness of over reacting then gives us a point of reentering with the trend. So even if you did take the trade. Price still moved in your favor but maybe only for a candle or two. Then it is back to the trend. So that is how the weaknesses of the two working together make a strength.

IF MACD continues to move in one direction and thus changing its position on the chart, the blue sto line stays with it confirming this strong trend. The BB visual on the screen showing a 45 degree angle will also confirm this. This is the reason I added the 3x3 cross on a 4H chart because it will not enter until there is a clear break with the normal trend. At this point you have stayed out of the trade and eliminating almost all the problem of the MACD shift. If price decides to shift back into the trend after you entered that will show up with the white line going back in the opposite direction.

So the white and blue lines are used to interpret the movement of the MACD. The EA keeps you out of the trade until there is a reversal move going on.  IF it is not a true turn around they will tell in plenty enough time to keep from getting a big loss. Again once your trade is in profit you put your stop losses and TS and TP in and you can monitor the trade. When you get a 3x3 cross on a 4H chart I have always seen some kind of profit, it is just a matter of getting your SL and TS and other things in. Sometimes it is just one candle that moves in the opposite direction but that is usually rare. Normally price will retrace at least a couple of candles on a 3x3 cross.

Any way if MACD has moved but that was 3 or 4 weeks ago on your chart. It makes no difference to what it is telling you now. Here is how it works. IF you turn on the EA for the trade it stays out until there is enough of a retrace to cause it to enter. I used to do this manually with some success but I would get whacked once in a while. That is because I couldnt wait for the reversal. With the EA waiting for you, my chances of succeeding went way up. I leave the entrance of the trade out of my hands because there is no such thing as an indicator that predicts reversals. This system gives you signals that it is probably coming but you dont know when. The 3x3 cross is what catches the reversal. The white and blue lines will tell you whether it is real or whiplash. I dont know how better you can make the system. It does keep the guess work out. When the 3x3 cross happens, enter, if white and blue got together stay in, if white only goes then get out. To me that is a good read and solves the MACD wandering problem.

--- 帖子 #34 ---
The above was an explanation of using the system to spot reversals and strong trends. When the market is ranging, the MACD line goes flat and gives you no indication of what is happening or is very difficult to read. Now the white and blue lines of a sto are at their best. BB is ranging flat, MACD is flat, now you have the great strength of a sto indicator to use. When both are above/below 85/15 and your on top/bottom of BB. That is a great signal. You turn the EA on and let it enter on the cross. If price suddenly takes off on you and begins running up the BB, the 3x3 cross has not happened and you are not in the trade. That 3x3 was designed to keep me out of the get in too early syndrome that plagued me with this system. I have always loved this system but that one trade running up the BB would kill me. Now I have a protection placed that protects me from one of my greatest trading weaknesses. The EA forces me to have the patience I dont have as a trader. Since I have been using it, I noticed sometimes it will take days for it to enter. That is a good thing. I showed you the GBP/NZD trade on page 1. I turned that on on Thursday and am still waiting for it to enter. I am sorry to admit I dont have that discipline but it does. So I want you to understand that I understand the MACD weakness and how I have dealt with it. It still is a great indicator.

--- 帖子 #42 ---
A stochastic and a stochastic oscillator are the same thing.

MT4 calls it a stochastic oscillator, some other charting applications simply call it a stochastic.

1st screen shot:

Your MACD in the top indicator pane. It is RED.

The 26/12/9 Stochastic in the bottom indicator pane. It is YELLOW.

The other two stochastics (7,3,3 and 14,5,3) are the same in both panes.

The Sto 12/26/9 gives virtually the same wave shape as your MACD. It does not drift and shift. It maintains its relative position with the other two stochastics and with the stochastic levels (15 and 85). You can look at it now or 20 weeks ago, and it will be the same.

2nd and 3rd screenshots:

The set up for the Stochastic 26/12/9, using the MT4 basic "Stochastic Oscillator" indicator.

--- 帖子 #43 ---
I believe there are better settings for the Long Term Stochastic than 12/26/9, to accomplish what you want.

It can be made more responsive with less lag.

I made it 12/26/9, to reproduce your MACD.

--- 帖子 #44 ---
OK I see the difference. It matches the MACD of MT4 but not the True MACD I am using. There are some variations. The True MACD is not as smooth and is more responsive than MT4 MACD. It goes higher and lower than the sto settings you use and the MT4 MACD. That is why I use it, the signal is clearer. I have tried different settings with STO but I dont get the same reads as I do with the MACD. One thing you have to remember about MACD, the only reading that matters is the one that is now. What it shows two weeks later is useless info. The problem you will find with a fixed sto or any other indicator and many are going to suggest other indicators is--no fixed indicator knows when there is a direction change in price action. With a movable MACD always rising/lowering you always know at that point it is giving a signal and then other indicators tell what price is doing in relation to that signal. Is it continuing the trend, is it retracing, or is it changing direction. I have tried many other indicators but MACD because it does keep moving will allow the other indicators to show you how price action relates to it. So a Sto indicator, which you are suggesting with different numbers will start coming off the top where MACD will stay there and keep sliding. Then the read comes off of the blue and white relationship with BB. White moves but not blue, trend continues and so on. I have tried some sto settings and I dont get the same kind of reads as I do with MACD.  The clincher is the  EA entrance. It will wait for a cross before getting in. I cant tell you what a life saver that thing is because it is the one thing that will wait out a run and get you in when it is over. Here is a USD/CHF trade my EA got me in on Monday and didnt get rewarded until late Friday. I will take half first thing Monday and then ride the other half and see how far it goes. Notice MACD sat on the bottom all week. Maybe two weeks from now price will reverse and push the MACD up into the middle of the chart but that wont mean a thing then. The trade is over by then. So right now the sliding MACD doesnt cause me any problems because on a 4H chart it takes so long for the slide to happen the trade is over.

--- 帖子 #47 ---
The problem I have is an internet problem China has a country wide firewall. Sometimes I cannot get out. Close half means to close 1/2 of the trade and keep the other half going. Place  your SL so you still will keep a profit and follow price to the bottom of the BB. You can then decide to close all or keep it going. Reset your SL as you go keeping as much profit as possible.

--- 帖子 #50 ---
How do you bypass the 3/3 cross if say you see a nice setup for a non trend trade and you don't want to wait for the cross? If you start the trade manually then switch on the EA, will the EA manage it from there? Thanks

--- 帖子 #51 ---
This EA does not manage trades, it only starts the trade. You have to put in the SL TP etc. The reason I did this is because of the great variance of the different currencies. The GBP/NZD maybe 200 pip back to the 20MA of the BB while another currency it may only be 30. So I leave that up to you. So you can enter manually and set up the trade your self. I do that at strong support and resistance points instead of waiting for the cross.

If you want a managed trade you can use the 60x90, 100/40 or some other of my EAs. They could manage the trade for you but they will reenter when the trade is closed. This system is really a manually trading system that only uses an EA to start the trade.

--- 帖子 #52 ---
With IBFX if I have a 2 lot trade I can close 1 lot out at any time and keep the other lot going. There maybe brokers that dont allow you to do that but I can with IBFX

Also turn off the EA when you have your trade parameters set. Other wise it will take profit and the EA will enter again on you and you may not want that. I am happy with that.

--- 帖子 #59 ---
All of these pairs are secondary trades. B&W are above/below 15/85, top or bottom of BB and are at a major support or resistance level. If they break and continue the trend the EA wont enter until the 3x3 cross. If they change direction the EA will put you in. Choose the ones you think maybe best but if they enter be tight with them and cover yourself with break even SL. Maybe they work Maybe not.

--- 帖子 #63 ---
Do u have a SL when it enter the trade ? Where did u put the SL ?

--- 帖子 #64 ---
The EA has a 1000 pip SL but if you change it, put the S&R on your screen and put the SL on the other side of a S&R line. The EA will do a reenter every 150 or 200 pips depending on which one your doing if price moves against you. I rarely do stop losses I close my trades manually if I dont like one. I will let a bad trade hit a R/S line and enter a countertrade and get the loss back to as close as zero as possible. You can only do this if you dont overmargin your account. If you play too high of lots to the amount of money you have in your account you need short SL. For instance if a trade goes 1000 pips against me it is about 5-10% of my account. The only way it will get that bad is if I am playing a major news story. Since I dont try to trade the big news stories I havent had that problem for almost 6 months now. If you use the EA you may put the trailing stop at 30 -50 pips so when the EA enters it brings you up to break even after price moves 30-50 pips. Then turn the EA off and manage your trade. I wait for the EA to enter and then I manage my trade manually. When you manage your trade then you put your SL, TS, etc. in based on which pair it is.

--- 帖子 #65 ---
OK dont know what to say, The warning system I believe waits for the close of the bar to warn so that may happen. Did not realize that until now. I know the EA does not. This is how I would handle that trade to keep you from whiplash. If price has brought your trade to around break even close all of them and restart or close the losing one and bring your SL so if it whip lashes you still are close to break even. You are at a better location for the trade and back to level one. I do this often and I stay out of trouble that way. So that is how I would handle it. I dont use my own warning system, I go by the lines and turn the EA on and let it handle it. I am not home all day so it does me little good.

I may have to change the warning system.

--- 帖子 #79 ---
The gbp/jpy, the 3 NZD, eur/nzd, eur/jpy, chf/jpy, and aud/nzd are all giving approximately the same signal. They may or maynot be a good trade. What you want to watch out for is the whiplash trade. They are all at that stage. I play them tight because they all can whiplash or take off for a nice run. The difficulty will be if they hit or get close to the 20MA line of the BB. that is where they could swing and become a trend continuation trade. That spot is showing to be a strong Support line if you put the S/R indicator on. So all of those currencies could bog down there or break through or bounce back up. That is one where I will take 1/2 profit, bring in a break even SL and let the rest ride and see if you get that breakthrough. I put a big gold line through all those S/R places.

--- 帖子 #80 ---
If you look at the Pic gbp/jpy above what usually happens is this is a retracement in an uptrend. The red line is angling up and white is coming down and blue is undecided at this point. You probably will not get a big move out of it but something over 100 pips is most likely then it will go into ranging mode or uptrend continuation. If you look at the last 4 weeks of action this area is a range area.

--- 帖子 #94 ---
If a currency has been giving a signal and it drops in price and then goes back to its original point, for instance like a double top or head/shoulder movement. I will go ahead and replay it even though the actual signal may not be there. It is basically the same trade all over again but it is going into its reversal pattern or there is a battle between the bears and the bulls. Price dropped 250+ points on all the gbp pairs so I will play them again. GBP/NZD has dropped for a nice profit already but the gbp/usd continues to go up. --- 帖子 #98 ---
Hi Nanningbob

Looks like you got a really good simple system going here, have been watching it all week & will continue to do so, thanks.

See extract below for explanation of yesterdays moves in GDP -

May 21 (Bloomberg) -- The pound dropped against every major currency after Standard and Poor’s signaled Britain may lose its top credit rating for the first time as the government’s finances deteriorate amid the economic slump.

The U.K. currency had its biggest decline in a week versus the dollar and dropped the most in two weeks against the euro after S&P lowered the outlook on the U.K.’s AAA rating to “negative” from “stable.” The dollar traded near an two- month low against the yen amid speculation the U.S. Federal Reserve will print more cash to boost purchases of assets to counter the global slump. The euro rose to a four-month high against the dollar after a European manufacturing and services survey beat economists’ forecasts.

Full article on Bloomberg

Thanks again

--- 帖子 #104 ---
Yes you can hold onto trades over the weekend because I only enter two levels deep and then decide to do something with the trade. That is the beauty of the 180-200 reentry. It is like this Eur/USD trade that just wont retrace right now. I am three levels deep with it so I am not really in any serious trouble as long as I get some retracement soon. If it doesnt retrace, I will take out the earliest entrance and be back to a two level trade. I like the flexibility that gives me. I hope to keep my losses smaller that way as compared with my other systems where that wouldnt work as well with the multiple reentries and larger reentries. So if price breaks north I will take a loss on one trade but still hope to salvage the other two. You can call it my stop loss area. That is my new rule, my stop loss is at the third entrance area if price continues to go against you. I did this earlier on the GBP/USD and it seemed like a good idea. If I dont get my retrace soon I will just close the one trade and play like I have two entrances and go for a small profit or break even. The first trade I close will be one of my rare losses. At least that is what I am hoping for. I think that is a major major impovement over some of my other systems. I posted the multiplication at 1.0 but I am using 1.5. So if you start with .02, then .03. then .05 and get rid of the .02 if you dont get the retrace and just take that as a losing trade. Try to break even with the .03 and . 05 trades and when they do. You still are near the top and you start a fresh trade at .02 and see if it will run. You also can go another 3 levels deep or 4-500 pips in the hole. with the red, white and blue still at the top, price has to give a some point of time. I hope I explained that in a way that is understandable but that, to me anyways, stops the big loss, death trade, that would occasionally happen. Does that make sense to you??

The gbp/usd has retraced two times in the last two days and broke above even the first time but the second time was a nice profit. Now I am looking at a third since it has gone up to hit that resistance line a third time. I have made up for the loss I took earlier when I closed the losing trade and I still have the potential of the break south for a nice profit. So that worked very well the first time I tried that. I still am waiting for price direction change and I am not at a loss on the currency.

What is mildly frustrating is the Eur/usd usually moves in a similar pattern with the gbp/usd and it hasnt this time. But again so far not a problem at this point. Now if it moves up all the way to closing and then gaps on me on Monday then it may become a problem but at this point it is liveable. If price continues to move against me I will close that first trade and leave the others running to deal with like I did above with the gbp/usd. This will keep my losses to a minimum if I do it right.  If you look at the charts price seems to keep moving in the same direction for a while after the weekend. That is difficult for a non trend following system but works better with a trend following system.

--- 帖子 #109 ---

This maybe the one thing we have been missing in my systems, controlling losses during a perfect storm. Also, manually putting in your reentries at the S/R lines instead of a set figure may give you your maximum profit. We can now add pending orders to the system to get our best entrances. The buy limit and sell limit seem to be the best ones for my system unless you are playing that price will break the S/R then you want to use Buy Stop and Sell Stop. On the Buy orders is there anyway you can get it to go on the Bid price instead of the Ask??

Pending Order

Pending order is the client's  commitment to the brokerage company to  buy or sell a security at a pre-defined price in the  future. This type of orders is used for opening of a trade position provided the  future quotes reach the pre-defined level. There are four types of pending  orders available in the terminal:
Buy Limit  — buy provided the  future "ASK" price is equal to the pre-defined value. The current price level is  higher than the value of the placed order. Orders of this type are usually  placed in anticipation of that the security price, having fallen to a certain  level, will increase;  Buy Stop  — buy provided the  future "ASK" price is equal to the pre-defined value. The current price level is  lower than the value of the placed order. Orders of this type are usually placed  in anticipation of that the security price, having reached a certain level, will  keep on increasing;  Sell Limit — sell provided the future "BID" price is equal  to the pre-defined value. The current price level is lower than the value of the  placed order. Orders of this type are usually placed in anticipation of that the  security price, having increased to a certain level, will fall;  Sell Stop — sell provided the future "BID" price is equal to the  pre-defined value. The current price level is higher than the value of the  placed order. Orders of this type are usually placed in anticipation of that the  security price, having reached a certain level, will keep on falling.

--- 帖子 #136 ---
I have come up with a formula that almost literally guarantees a break even on almost any trade. I hope I can explain it in a way you can understand. I will call it 242424 strategy and a variation242646. If you think in boxes of 400 pips every 200 pips I think you can understand how this works. I am only going to show this in the worst case scenario. Any other price action and you make a profit.

Trade A is entered with .20 lots and it goes 200 pips against you. You then enter .40 lots. If price reverses 70-80 pips in your favor, (depending on currency and spread) you are at break even with the trade. You go from there. If price continues to go against you another 200 pips. You reenter .20, if price goes back to the .40 entrance, 200 pips, you are at break even. This is how I got the name 2,4,2

If price goes against you, you drop the first level entrance and that is a losing trade. The 4th level now you enter .40 if price reverses back to the level .20 entrance you are back at break even again. However, if you enter .60 you also cover your first original loss. You can keep following this startegy every 200 pips until you come up with a winner or break even trade.

The 2 4 2 4 2 4 2 will give you small manageable losses until you get out of the trade with a break even. You keep your margin usage at an acceptable level at all times and never get into the death trade.

The 2 4 2 6 4 6 ............ will give you coverage up to 1000 pips (or more if you wish and have the margin) against you and still come out with an almost zero loss trade even though price went against you 1000 pips. You literally keep you losses to a minimum. To go into trades as overbought/oversold as we do and still cover ourselves up to 1000 pips afterwards is a pretty darn safe strategy. As long as you dont over margin your account with too big of lots, you can safely trade this way. You pocket your winners and zero out your losses.

The purpose of this is not the typical martingale strategy of doubling up until you win or wipe out your entire account. But this strategy will limit the loss to break even so your overall trading will be a constant increase. I only hope I explained this in a way you can understand. COOL HUH

You can also do this with the 150 but you are using 300 pip blocks instead of 400. I dont know if someone can program an EA to do this but it would be fantastic of we just turned it on and didnt have to manually put these in. Happy trading.

Huge as in the lost in a single currency pair cannot be recover by itself and need to depend on other currency pair to recover the lost. The problem with no loss is that a single rare event will wipe out months of profit.

--- 帖子 #142 ---
The purpose is to close out a losing situation by getting as close to break even as possible. If you let the early level keep running with the loss then you need bigger lots or a bigger retrace to recover the loss. That is Martingale philosophy. What happens is sooner or later the perfect storm comes and wipes you out. This limits the loss to a size where you have a chance to break even on the trade and then keep your profits in the bank. That is the philosophy behind the system. It also makes it manageable as to when to open and close the trades. If you have ever used a martingale system you know as the debt gets bigger you wonder, will I get the retrace or will I wipe out my account. IN this you take the scheduled loss and then when the retrace happens you stand a good chance of getting back to even. Believe me your mental framework is so much better when you see that your balance has not been damaged. You take the philosophy that I will have my winners and I am going to limit my losers. If you are getting beat up by price for several days in a row but your balance has stayed stable, you know the profits will come.

--- 帖子 #152 ---
I can't see why anyone would do this, so must be missing something.

When you get to L4 you'd be down $240 from 3 positions (120,80,40). You close the first 0.2 trade and take the $120 hit. You then open a 0.4 trade, so your position is down $240 (120 closed 120 open) and Long 1.0 (0.4+0.2+0.4).

You'd be in the same position if you left the 0.2 open and just opened a further 0.2 (ie. 0.2+0.4+0.2+0.2). You'd be down $240 (all open) and Long 1.0. No matter where the trade heads, up or down, the resulting profit or loss will be the same. Buying 0.2 you'd incur one third the spread of closing 0.2 and opening 0.4.

Leaving positions open and using 2,4,2,2,-2,2,-2 is the same as having only 3 positions open with 2,4,2,4,2,4,2.

Beyond higher spreads, a problem I see with 2,4,2,4 scheme is that psychologically you could think you're doing better than you are. An open position of -120 with the other -120 taken feels better than an open position of -240. It's like when being eaten by a piranha thinking 'I need to protect 100% of what is remaining of me' rather than 'I need to protect the 90% of me that's remaining'.

Cheers

Knoxy

BEIJING — China has issued a sweeping directive requiring all personal computers sold in the country to include sophisticated software that can filter out pornography and other “unhealthy information” from the Internet.

The software, which manufacturers must install on all new PCs starting July 1, would allow the government to regularly update computers with an ever-changing list of banned Web sites.

The rules, issued last month, ratchet up Internet restrictions that are already among the most stringent in the world. China regularly blocks Web sites that discuss the Dalai Lama, the 1989 crackdown on Tiananmen Square protesters, and the Falun Gong, the banned spiritual movement.

But free-speech advocates say they fear the new software could make it even more difficult for China’s 300 million Internet users to obtain uncensored news and information.

“This is a very bad thing,” said Charles Mok, chairman of the Hong Kong chapter of the Internet Society, an international advisory group on Internet standards. “It’s like downloading spy-ware onto your computer, but the government is the spy.”

--- 帖子 #178 ---
BTB "Betting the Bank and selling the house"

When is a good time to bet the bank and sell a house on a trade. Of course there really isnt such a thing but here is one that is almost always a gold mine. I mention this because the gbp/chf looks like one now, so I will show it ahead of time. Using only the blue line in my system you will see divergence. Divergence is when the peak highs/lows are going higher/ lower but the peak highs/lows on the blue line are going lower/higher. Noticed the 4 divergences I marked on the gbp/chf over the last 8 weeks. Divergance is a good read on a major retracement or change of direction in price. On a 4H chart it is very powerful. Notice how I marked them #1-4.

Look at #1:

See the gold line in the chart how the lows are continuing to go down but the blue line the low peaks are now going higher. This is a very good in

--- 帖子 #195 ---
Go to the right hand corner and click on the smiley face. It will allow you to remove the EA. OR you can create a template with no ea on it and trade manually. The difference between .01 and .10 depends on your broker and their lot sizes. IBFX Micro lots .01 = 1 penny but .01 with a regular account is 10 cents. So it depends on your broker.

--- 帖子 #202 ---
Yes I have used this system in some form over the last two years manually. I just find using the EA a great way to enter trades because many times I am not around when the best time to enter comes. To those who use this with weekly pivots etc will probably find manual trades to be a better way. Especially using pending orders etc. So to each person's taste you can trade.

To set up the trade manually you could use the MT4 MACD removing the histogram and adding the two sto lines. Then putting BB and some form of S/R lines or Pivot system and trade very successfully manually. Because I am not home often during the day I find the EA very usefull and keeps me out of the runners most of the time before entering. More experienced traders who are used to Pivot trading or S/R trading will probably feel more comfortable manually trading this system. My biggest problem in trading is entering too early and so I let the EA discipline myself. That is my trading weakness so the EA is my crutch, but a wise one for me.

--- 帖子 #206 ---
If you see an x that means the EA is not loaded properly. Drag the EA on the screen and make sure you have clicked the box for live trading. When you do that the x will turn to a smiley face and it is working.

--- 帖子 #213 ---
The MACD red line is not a fixed line but the STO lines are. If you use the full screen and 4 weeks of data on the screen, you will find the indicator will give the info you need for starting your trade. The purpose of the indicator is to give you a good time to turn on the EA and look for the reversal. That is the purpose. I have tried having all fixed indicators and none give as good of a signal as a moving MACD. The EA is your protection against a continued run and the multi level entrances give you the flexibility to adjust to price action. With the 242 recovery system we have covered just about all the bases need to trade tops and bottoms. The MACD is a lagging but moving indicator and your best entrances are where the blue and white are crossing it. However, since we dont know exactly when that will happen the moving MACD keeps adjusting until it does. The EA helps you in getting that entrance.

It has taken me about two years to get this to all fit together.  I am going to post my results for the last month and they are quite astonding. I am very pleased with my live test of this system, in fact more than pleased, I am estatic. I want to finish my trades today and then post my results tonight.

--- 帖子 #218 ---
Yes, when all three lines, red white and blue, are above the 85 line you turn on the sell EA. It will not enter until the 3MA open crosses teh 3 MA close. This way it helps you from entering a trade too early. If price goes against you the EA doesnt enter until it retraces. Once all three lines are above the 85 line or below the 15 for the buy EA, you are in a major retrace or price turn around territory. Once the EA enters the trade you then turn it off and manuallly control the trade as per the instructions found in post 1. This is a manual traidng system with an EA that helps you enter the trade. Again reread the manual posted on page 1 post 1. It has pictures and examples of how this system works. If after reading it you have more questions I will be happy to answer them.

--- 帖子 #219 ---
Hit control I and see if you have a moving average added to your screen and delete it. It looks like one of my rejected experimented ideas. Then resave your template. Also you have a buy EA on and that is a sell trade.   I also see that no EA is attached to the chart so you need to get the buy EA with the buy screen.

--- 帖子 #220 ---
The "2,4,2" rescue system seems interesting concept, I've been reading a up on it.

For example I have the following trade:

L1 0.02

L2 0.04

L3 0.08

- For 2,4,2 rescue at what lot size should I start with for 1st entry?

- any recommended tp for each rescue level?

the moment the 1st entry for 2,4,2 trade is made the first trade will be closed to maintain limited number of trades.

I want to sort out the logic and attempt to code a "2,4,2" rescue EA.

--- 帖子 #221 ---
Ok the L1 trade is closed because you are just taking a loss on that. You then enter your level 4 trade but it now becomes a level 3 because you closed out your first level. You now  match the size of the  old level 2 trade which is .04. If it retraces to the level 3 entrance the .08 is now at 0 and the profit from the second .04 matches the loss of the other .04 and you have 0 out your trade. Your only loss is the .02 which you took earlier. This is to help you minimize your loss.

If the trade goes against you again to another level you would then close out the first .04 trade (your original 2nd level) and then enter a .08 and try to 0 out the trade again but this time you would have 2 losing trades. Clear as a dirty river I hope.

In using this system I have only gone one level at a loss because I have always gotten a retrace on the 4th level entrance. A couple of trades I took a loss but reduced my losses with the retrace and a couple of others it went farther and the whole thing took a  small profit. One time I tried to just take a profit on each level because I felt price had not just retraced but actually turned around. So I closed the trades down in profit as price moved back to my original entrance point. I only did this once and I did it because fundamental news seem to favor such a strategy. So that is a variation of the 242 system.

--- 帖子 #228 ---
Since I dont use Alpari this is a difficult question for me to answer, however, what ever works on the demo will work the same on a live account. Or should anyway. So if IBFX .01 is a penny maybe Alpari its ten cents in stead of a a penny. If it doesnt work at all then you may have to use .10 which then should be a dime but with some brokers it could be a dollar. It also depends on what kind of account you have with them. Some brokers have a Micro account in which .10 equals a dime and then on a regular account .10 equals a dollar. So you need to ask them what is what. So give them a call and ask what does .01 lot equal in a micro account and so forth. Happy trading.

--- 帖子 #236 ---
i RECEIVED THIS TODAY

SALT LAKE CITY— July 20, 2009—Interbank FX (IBFX.com), a worldwide provider of online foreign currency (Forex/FX) trading, announced today a solution for NFA Compliance Rule 2-43 affecting all NFA regulated Forex brokers.

Using our proprietary backoffice solutions, Interbank FX will allow our Meta Trader 4 platform to remain 100 percent compliant, while retaining order functionality and flexibility for customers trading. The MT4 platform will continue to function as our customers have experienced over the last several years. This includes the ability for customers to use fully functional Expert Advisors, Stops Losses, Take Profits, Trailing Stops and Limit Orders without making any needed adjustments.

“Certain US competitors have decided that their solution to the new FIFO rules are to move their customers overseas, rather than being compliant,” said Todd Crosland, Chairman and President of Interbank FX. “At Interbank FX, we have embraced the NFA’s efforts to help protect customers and provide a seamless solution without any changes to their current trading strategies.”

The only modification for customers will be their daily and monthly account statements, coming directly from the proprietary Interbank FX backoffice system using NFA FIFO offsetting procedures. The FIFO rule takes effect beginning July 31/August 1, 2009.

Interbank FX is currently working on a step-by-step video which will be available shortly on our web site, www.ibfx.com.

--- 帖子 #247 ---
This thread is for the 4H trading system. The 180x100 is talked about in the 60x90 thread. The 4H trading system is a manual trading system except for the entrance which is done by an EA. Then you manually manage the trade after that.

It depends on how much in profit the trade is. If it is only 20-30 pips I will set it at 0 and move it up with time, if it is past 30 or 40 I will set it at +10 and let the trade run. Sometimes I will add a TS to the trade so the +10 will increase over time. To be honest I really dont have any set rules other than, dont let a trade in profit become a loser. There is nothing more discouraging than to see a trade go +70 like the gbp trade did yesterday andthen come back and then go -70 in the hole. If I had put a 30 or 40 TS on that one I would have had a minumum 30 or 40 profit trade. Most of the time I check my trades every 4-8 hours and decide what to do next. I never wait for candle close, if price is hitting a S/R line to me is the real key. Simply put do I let it ride or do I TP now? If I let it ride where do I put my TS or move my Stop to? I have this philosophy, I am always happy taking profit, you can never beat yourself up for taking a 80TP only to see price go up another 300 pips. It could just as easily gone back to -80. Once that trade gets to profit you NEVER want it to become a losing trade, that will really kill you mentally. However, even if you pocket a dozen +10 and 5 +0, you still made money and pocketed 120 pips that day, week, or month.

To manually trade the 180x100 you would have to take the EA off the screen and then manage the trade manually. What I do with the 180x100 though is I keep the EA on and will use the MT4 trailing stop. Once I am in profit I will set the trailing stop on a trade. For example I had a gbp/jpy trade go about 80+ so I set a trailing stop at 40 behind it making sure I would have a minimum 40 pip profit and then I let it run. You can do this with the EA on. I also have changed the TP on some trades because price seems to be moving rapidly and looks like it will move more than the 100TP so I will reset it to 200 with a TS. This way I try to maximize the move for profit. Most of the time though I will take profit when the white line goes to the opposite side of the Sto indicator and/or I see price has hit a support/resistance line.

I hope this answers your question, if not ask again and I will try to better understand your question.

--- 帖子 #248 ---
Hey NBob, i put your stuff on test, using warning system. I use only best setups with EA entrance, however for SL i put either the other end of Bollinger band or swing high for sell trades (versa for buy trades). That dictates TP, which in most cases is bigger than i estimate its attainable. Ideal would be if i get at least 1:1 RR, I aim for 2:1 generally. With this in Mind i am interested mainly in frequency of good entries by EA, which would get good win rate with less losses.

So my main goal in testing is get a sample of hitrates, win/loss rates, win/loss sizes.

From quick over-the-shoulder estimates I reckon, that there could be many small win hits with danger being offset by some large losses.

--- 帖子 #258 ---
ill bite the bullet and take the loss? I know you use the 242 to try to stay out of trouble - correct?

It also seems that this is your preferred system even over your own fully automated ea's. Is this true?

Thanks for your comments, appreciated. People do say thank you often but I dont always respond to each one. Taking a loss is always the most critical decision in my systems. The profit making part is there but knowing when to take a loss that is the critical part. There are just so many variables, kinda hard to explain. As you probably have noticed I love the S/R indicator on the charts. I dont trade without it anymore so I carefully watch where price is fighting. As long as I see price banging off a 4 week high or low I feel really safe in that trade. For instance you saw I bailed out early on several trades this week. The most important one was the GBP/CHF. That thing has been trending down with only one major retrace for 3 weeks now. So I was really cautious with it and probably made the right decision. Why? Because I know from experience the GBP/CHF will run and run sometimes. Same with the NZD, CAD, and AUD pairs. CHF pairs will too but not as often. I guess it just comes from experience, I look at a trade and go OH OH that looks like trouble. It is why I like trading the 4H chart. I can see 4-5 weeks at a time on the screen. This system you realize you may have trouble if it enters and then reverses and goe beyond the previous high or low. I really start paying attention to a trade like that. But I slapped a 200x200 on it, so I have a lot of range. For instance the eur/gbp trade has my attention right now. It has gone over -100 but has finally broken its trendline. If it reverses again and starts trending up. I may take that one out because I dont have a lot of money invested in that trade yet. So to poorly answer your question it is a trade by trade decision. Most of the time I am wrong and I have closed early a trade that would be profitable but my overall equity goes up.

Of all my trading systems this one is the most profitable and rewarding. The average trade is 1-3 days long and DD is very low. Because I use the 4H chart I only have to watch over my trades 2 or 3 times a day. Right now I am doing this thread as once a day. That will change when price gets more volatile. Unlike my other systems where you have to trade .01-.03 with a couple of hundred bucks. I will go .05-.10 depending on the currency pair. Lower for the more volatile, higher lots for the slower ones. This is the system I trade on my big account.

If you read the thread you will see the biggest criticism is the moving MACD line. Even though that maybe perceived as a problem the moving line doesnt adjust that much until a week or two later and the trade is done by then. So it is not a false read. I have used this system and some variations of it for several years but it wasnt until I did the 3x3 cross with a BB signal did I finally solve my problem of entering too early on a trade. That was always my biggest downfall. With that problem solved, I just turn on the EA whenever I see a trade signal and dang if that thing wont wait out a run that I would not. I had one trade it waited 4 days to enter but when it did +210 pips in one day instead of entering too early, 450 pips in the hole looking for that retrace to get out with a loss. So that 3x3 is a life saver to me.

Even though in my book I talk about secondary and other trades. I really only do primary trades now. They are the simplest and take the least amount of thinking.

--- 帖子 #263 ---
Hi Bob, I don't think that is the exact criticism of MACD.

I have read the previous posts, and I believe the issue with MACD is that you say it must be below the 15 or above the 85 line for entry - HOWEVER - if you drag the chart left and right, you will notice that the MACD line moves up and down.

i.e. It is no really anchored to a proper number on the Y axis, but shifts up and down as you scroll back and forth along the chart.

--- 帖子 #264 ---
If you use the 4 week view it works fine. If you go back in time it also moves but like I said before when it comes to the next week or week after the trade is done so the moving MACD on a 4H chart is not a problem. It is basically static in the week you want to use it. Once you understand this basic principle it works pretty darn good, not 100% no system does that but it works. The two added features that filter out most of the false signals are the BB and the 3x3 EA. Once you put this all together it works very well. It is the most profitable system I have posted. The MACD, sto lines give you a trading signal that price is about to exhaust itself. The BB confirms and the 3x3 EA will protect you from many of the run ups. If you get in and  price goes against you, you multi level the trade until you can retrace for an out, like I did with the gbp/chf and eur/chf trades recently or go into profit, which I think the eur/gbp or aud/cad will do. Either way the so called problem is known but it is also dealt with. This is my most profitable system by the way because I can trade much bigger lots on fewer funds than my EAs.

I used to use this system on lower TF like the 1H and 30M charts and would do quite well but I would get whacked once in a while. That was caused by the moving MACD. However, once you get to a 4H chart and 4 weeks of chart on your screen the MACD movement is lessened down to a small percent. If you go back in time the MACD moves because the numbers being put into its averages changes the figures from week to week so you go back 1 week earlier you enter the a new set of math from something that happened 5 weeks ago, however, those figures are irrelevant to the now. The now is what is the MACD line telling us relevant to the last 4 weeks along with the STO lines. That is the key, that gives me my signal, not to trade but turn on the EA. Once price has retraced enough to cause the 3x3 cross, I am almost guaranteed at least one or two bars of reversal. That gives me at least 8 hours to bring my stop loss to +10 or more and makes it at least a minimal profit trade. The rare occasions where is peeks and continues, I have 3 choices:

1. wait out the battle of the bulls and bears, what I am doing with the eur/gbp trade now

2. ride it out entering a second or third time

3. Looking for my best out on that one particular trade.

Even though I had individual trades not go well, most of them did and they have covered any loss easily that I took on any of the  bad trades. The moving MACD is not as big of a problem as some have made it. Just like any system it has its losers but I have consistantly month after month kept my winning percentage at 70-85% and I will take that to the bank. Dont focus on the losers to the point you miss the vast majority of the winners. And this system does produce a constant flow of winners. I dont know anyone who publishes his trades on line before the day and keeps it going month after month. Its the consistancey of this system. I dont think I have published a single losing week since I have posted this system. Yes I have had some losing days, but not a losing week. Try it. It is a simple easy to understand system.

--- 帖子 #287 ---
Here is the gbp/usd trade and why I took it. In my manual I call this a secondary trade. I drew a yellow line across the screen and you can see where this area is a very strong resistance area (red dots) and a very strong support area (blue dots). --- 帖子 #302 ---
I just wanted to share my logic on taking a losing trade where, when and why.

There are times when price may not get anywhere near your first level. As you know I have been sitting on this eur/aud trade for quite a while and it had gone 3 levels deep. To me it was time to look for my best exit and take it. Now I want to get as close to 0 as possible but sometimes that isnt possible. Using S/R lines and my STO lines helps in making these decisions. Yesterday I took the +50 L3 trade because I could bank my profit, white sto line was above 85 and it was at a resistance level. If price continues up, which it did, I banked a TP and then lower my debt. If price goes down I still have that 3rd level to  play again in the future. So that is why for my yesterday's move.

Today, I see white and blue above 85 and my 2nd L is in profit. There are two ways to play this. I can bank my  profit and then have 2L to come back with on this trade or with my other profits I can 0 out. I chose to zero out this trade because yesterday I did this with the GBP/USD and I got into trouble having to go back to a 2L trade and try to 0 out that trade. I already had it at -17 so now I have to do it again. So with the eur/aud I have white and blue above 85, price bouncing off of resistance and the 40MA (a very commone bounce point) but the big decider was I already have many other trades going and I dont need another one going into the hole again so I take the loss on that one.

--- 帖子 #320 ---
OK you are deep in the hole on a trade and you made a mistake in trading. Last week I had a profit on the gbp/usd and had decided to close one position for a profit and keep the other position at-17. Well, the trade went against me big time so I had to fight my way out. I ended up going 3L deep but Sunday night/Monday morning (Asian time) during the JPY session there was some good retracement activity. I made a decision to close some trades to lessen my losses and others I kept to see if  price would run. Here is my logic on the the gpb/usd since that was the trade I was in the most trouble.

Price retraced to a support level, I marked it with a yellow line. Knowing this possibley could be my best out if the gbp/usd kept on its uptrend I went ahead and took my loss at the yellow line. However, I also knew it was possible that price could continue to run if it broke that support so I put a SellStop order at the white line. Price ran through and I picked up another 40 pips. I closed it out at the next support line which was also the 40MA.

SO this is how this particular trade went from beginning to end:

9-3 open trade gbp/usd post #287 P.20

9-4 carryover-72 added a 2L during the day.

9-7 closed +74 carryover -17 Post #296 p. 20

(here is where I make a mistake and not close both levels. I decided to ride the 2nd level out)

9-8 carryover -136 #300

9-9 carryover -206 #301

9-10 carryover -424 #306

9-12 carryover -394 #311

9-14 closed -100 #319 & 320

total with +74 profit -100 close total trade -26 pip loss.

That is how you can minimize your losses.

The distance from first entry of this group of trades until close of the last trade was just over -200 pips however the loss on the books is only -26. This is one of the benefits of multi-level trading.

So that is how I handled the gbp/usd bailout trade to minimize my loss.

--- 帖子 #326 ---
Just an observatioin. If you eyeball the 4H chart and go back in time, I think you will notice that most currencies will hit their high or low for the week on Wed. or Thurs. Now that isnt always true but I think it is safe to say that most of the time you will see that. Let me know if any of you have spotted this same kind of trend in currencies. You can plan your retracements around those support or resistance lines at that time.

--- 帖子 #327 ---
I happen to agree with this guy. The pessimism concerning the USD is way overblown. Yes we hit  a bad bump here but most European countries and Japan carry a much bigger debt to GDP ratio than the USA. Just a reminder of history, during WW2 the USA carried twice the amount of debt to GDP than we are now and that didnt cause hyperinflation or all the other doom and gloom being predicted now. So Read and enjoy. Just an opinion.

Has the greenback really lost its preeminent place in the world? Not according to currency expert Marc Chandler, who explains why so many are—wrongly—pessimistic about both the dollar and the U.S. economy.

Making Sense of the Dollar explores the many factors—trade deficits, the dollar’s role in the world, globalization, capitalism, and more—that affect the dollar and the U.S. economy and lead to the inescapable conclusion that both are much stronger than many people suppose.

Marc Chandler has been covering the global capital markets for twenty years as a foreign exchange strategist for several Wall Street firms. He is one of the most widely respected and quoted currency experts today.

http://www.ordering1.us/bloombergboo...ct.php?pid=345

I feel I can recover and still profit this week and not carry the risk of hitting a big loss in case the dollar keeps sliding. This is an account protection move. In my 60x90 thread I talk about the slow sliding death trade and I just dont want to hang on to these much longer. So I just cut my losses. I am adding a bunch of new trades and my carry over is high. I also am thinking about when I cross the -1000 carryover barrier I should make a decision to keep it from getting bigger, especially when I am adding a bunch of new trades. I am experimenting with that idea to see if that keeps my account in safe margin territory so I can trade bigger lots. Just an idea for now.

--- 帖子 #332 ---
u are using standard account mode

go to file> open account  and make sure it says mini  not standard

Before u do this x out of all charts. Then do as I said above. Then u will have fresh account. Now run profiles like before and all the charts will pop up.

Profile will only work for mini accounts not standard. It is setup to open pairs with

"m" on the end.

Because u r in standard account mode your charts do not end in "m". Therefore it will say waiting fir update forever!

switch to mini account and will pop up instantly

--- 帖子 #333 ---
I feel it would be unfair to make a call and then didnt make the trade. I prefer diversification over a wide field. Also even though -1300 pips may seem a lot, I am using 10-15% of my margin. When I get to -1300 I am about 15% of my margin so I have plenty of room to deal with bad trades. Last Friday, if you remember, I was at -1300 and the Monday retraces came in. I closed out the GBP trade but kept the aud/usd and eur/usd. I should have taken all three as minimum losses at that point and my DD would be  much less now. So we make decisions and sometimes they work and sometimes they dont. If I had done the opposite, kept the GBP and closed the two aud,eur trades I actually would have made a small profit. It is funny how forex works against you sometimes. It seems like I should write down, this little voice tells me to do this but I should do the opposite. Still beside all my mistakes and misjudgements I am still doing very well the last 2 months and cant complain. I am doing this to not only keep a record of my own trades but making my decisions public lets new traders see the real up and down of this business so they will get more realistic expectations. Here is a trade live going bad, what do you do. Here I make dumb mistakes not like the sale ads I get with guys trying to get you to buy their systems but never tell you about the downside of them. I like the hpye of this guy:
You can choose 3 easy monthly payments of                              $733 each. That is 2200 bucks to learn how to trade a breakout and move your SL to breakeven when you get into profit. Good hype and if you dont buy by midnight tonight this offer will be gone forever. But dont worry, he will scavange some system off of FF and be back 2 or 3 months later with his newest trading system. Hey I can teach you a breakout system. Put a 5MA high and 5 MA low on your screen on a 4H or 1H chart, wait for the red square news stories on FF and when price breaks the high or low enter. What they dont tell you is the banks get their orders in first, then their best customers, then the broker gets the feed and you are facing a high spread because the broker knows he cant get you the best price. REQUOTE, REQUOTE, REQUOTE. (This is probably what happened to my EUR/CHF trade yesterday. Got requoted to a small profit or big spread). I am tired of looking at a screen waiting for some certain rules to happen and then ........................... I prefer to trade longer term and let the trade develop. Sometimes it closes the same day, sometimes I can sit on a trade for a week or more. Much easier on my health, heart, eyes, etc.

OH gotta go only 9--2200 dollar training programs left.

today, there are only  9
courses remaining

--- 帖子 #343 ---
thankyou, Bob.

With regard to the recovery system 242424.

When there is a setup and we turn the EA on and let the EA pick the entry for us. Do we trade with 0.1 as per original EA or we have to key in 0.2 lot for the first setup ?

But on 2nd though, you name it recovery, it means we have already in lossing positions and you aply the 242 recovery system trying to reduce the loss. If this is the case, you allow up to how many levels L1, L2 or L3 before using 0.2, 0.4, 0.2 recovery system ?

--- 帖子 #344 ---
How much your lot size depends on what you want to trade. That is dependent on your margin, leverage and risk factors. The EA is set at a minimum. You have to find what you are comfortable with. Right now I am trading .05 on 400 dollars at 400:1 leverage. I can keep my margin usage between 5-15% of my account with this. You will notice when I pass the -1300 barrier I am closing a trade now and then. It is what I am experimenting with right now. I try to keep my margin usage to less than 15% of my account. This way if I have to use a recovery I have the margin to do that.

The 2.4.2 recovery can start on the 4th level. When you get 4 levels deep you drop the 1st level and try to make the other 3 break even. I am trading more conservative than that right now by trying not going much deeper than the 3rd level. If I had a 1-2000 dollars in my account I probably would not have closed any losing trades this week for a loss because I would have the funds to ride the trades out. I also am up for the month so I am more interested in preserving the profits I have already made. So I know you guys want hard and fast rules but I dont believe you can always trade the market that way. You have to learn to trade with some discretion. I know if price breaks a strong daily S/R line it may go on a long run. The gbp/chf has done that so I decided not to use the recovery system on it but just take the loss. I did leave one level going and it is approaching another strong S/R level. If it breaks that one I am going to  close and be done with that pair until it finally gets done with its run. Yes I will take a beating on that series of trades but my account will be healthy and still up for the month. So S/R is very important to me when applying recovery methods. If I am 3 levels into a pair and then it breaks a major daily S/R level I have learned to just eat it, fighting a move like that is asking for a lot of trouble. So it is hard to write hard and fast rules when trading is discretionary like that. The majority of time you will get the bounce but once in a while price will take a run and knowing when to bail out is very important. Hopefully this is clear as mud.

--- 帖子 #345 ---

--- 帖子 #346 ---
I have in my templates a blank screen. It is not blank but a template with no EA on it, I just call it a blank. Just take the basic screen, take off the EA, change the back ground color and name it 4H blank or 60x90 blank. I just put that template on and then cancel the order. I do this for any currency pair I decide needs to be manually traded versus EA. It is how my 4H trading system works. The EA enters the trade and then I take it off and manually trade it after that.  Basically right now I let the EA handle the first 2 levels and then I handle most, but not all, my trades after that. The main reason is I enter my extra levels at S/R instead of some predetermined number. Also, if news is telling me a currency may go on a long run (more than 3-500 pips) and I am already 2 levels deep, I may choose to just take the loss instead of trying to recover the trade.

--- 帖子 #347 ---
I dont mind strong trends as long as they have their retracements. However, on rare occassions a currency will trend so strongly, the fundamental news is so big, the currency cant retrace and just runs and runs. A good example is the 10 day run of the USD/CHF last December. Those you want to avoid at all costs. The GBP/CHF maybe in one now. It keeps breaking daily S/R lines without bouncing or retracing.

--- 帖子 #358 ---
I have no idea what you are talking about. Unless you multiply L1 by 10 you cant have a 2L of .10 from .01. There is no default for level 2. It is determined by the multiplication of Level 1.

--- 帖子 #362 ---
Margin usage thoughts. As I trade this system I have noticed that right now I am peaking at 1300 - 1500  pips in the hole at times. Using this figure and making sure you want to have  plenty of margin to cover your trades a figure of keeping yourself at no more than 10-15% of your account being used as a max. I have come up with this formula.

one penny then would need 100 dollars

nickel trade would need 500 dollars

dime trades would need 1000 dollars and

1.00 trades would need 10,000 dollars to trade with comfort.

This would keep your account within safe distances from wipeout and still give you room for a sudden unexpected run. Once an account starts using more than 15% you then would be looking to exiting losing trades to keep you under that percentage. This sounds fairly reasonable for trading a multi-level system. Any thoughts??

--- 帖子 #367 ---
I post my buy/sells every day before the jpy session. All you have to do is follow along. So many guys gave this thread a negative rating I feel I need to prove they were wrong. In fact the vast majority, and probably none of them, even tried to trade the system. Over  half of the negative votes were posted before the first trade was even made. So I think their votes are basically dishonest. Like I said I have used this system for almost 3 years now and this is the final product. I think if you just do primary trades and not overmargin your account you can safely trade this profitably.

When I trade this I am using .05 on 400 dollars so if you have a 1000 or more trading .10 lots should be no probelm if that is a dime account. This system is not like my EAs in which you need lots of margin, this trading method uses much smaller margin and higher lot sizes. Most currencies will only give you 1 maybe 2 trades a week and sometimes none. So it is a very selective trading system. Basically you are trying to trade off of the high or low for the week. My study of the Forex showed me that every currency has a high or low every TF and I think the easiest to trade highs and lows is the 4H or the weekly high or low. That is the basics of this system.

Most trades you will enter and get a profit the first level. Some on the 2nd and the 3rd level on up you try to break even as best you can. Just simply playing the odds that every currency will retrace 100% of the time. That is the one absolute 100% fact I have found about the FOREX. Every currency will retrace at some point. The other key to this over my other EAs is we keep using the same lot size almost all the time. If I enter .05 1st level I will enter .05 second and .05 third level also. If it stays a level 1 trade it makes profit. If it goes two levels as long as the 2nd level retraces over 50% I make profit. If I go 3 levls the closer I get to the 2nd Level entrance the smaller my loss will be. I will increase my lot size to .08 on the 4th level so my retrace doesnt have to be as big to get to break even. I am doing that now with the gbp/chf trade so I can break even around the 200 pip retrace instead of needing 250 or more. Imagine this, the trade is over 700 pips in the hole but I only need a 200+ pip retrace to break even. Something the gbp/chf can easily do in one day. Also money wise it is not even 30 dollars in the hole, so if I have to close it out, it is by no means a killer or account killing trade. The only question is on the retrace will you make a profit or cut your losses to a  minimum. So I am trading a system that is 100% guaranteed of getting a retrace. I only need to protect myself from over margin my account. Patiently waiting for the retrace or price turnaround is the key. I think it is a simple and easy formula to follow.

If go to level 3, you will use 0.8 lot.... is there any formular that can calculate how many lot to increased on 3rd level onward ?

--- 帖子 #372 ---
There is an xl spreadsheet available for optimizing lot sizes in this thread or the other thread by Bob.

--- 帖子 #373 ---
That is what we did with the EAs 60x90 and 180x100 each level increases. In this though we take a different approach. Our idea is to catch the retracement at the top or bottm. the blue and white lines above/below the 15/85 lines are usually hit this around 70-80% of the time, with a level 1 or 2 trade. It does get tough when currencies are trending strongly like the pound is now. But with that thought we try to use one lot size so you can compute easily your margin usage and trade bigger lots. So it goes like this all 1L trades are profitable. All level 2 trades become profitable with a 50% retracement and all level 3 trades can break even at a 1/3 retracement from the original position. I think the odds of getting this in overbought and oversold situations are very high. I believe the returns are very good and the chances of happening very high. If we dont then we go to manual trading and try to zero out or minimize our loss. That is the basic philosophy of this system. If you get skillful at minimizing losses then profitability with this system I believe is very high.

--- 帖子 #376 ---
In this system us the same lot size, a 50% retrace gets you to break even. The gaps were killers this morning but very often they retrace quickly during the day. Too many good buys to pass up for some traders. Most currencies have been trending heavily the last 2 weeks and this happens at times. If you can survive this with as few and small of losses as possible you will get a good deal of  confidence in your trading skills. The only regret I am having right now is not completely closing out that one gbp/chf trade, all the rest can be dealt with.

Buys usd/jpy nzd/jpy chf/jpy

sells usd/chf

The gaps put the jpy in position to buy. Some of you guys may not have experienced Monday morning gaps like this before so here you go. Counter trade those bottoms and tops and get ready to close out minimum losses or minimum profits if your deep in the hole. If you are in a comfortable margin range you can try to ride this out. That is what I am doing but whenever you get some 200 pips away be ready to add a level at S/R and take the EA off so you dont have a double entry. If you want to encrease your lot size I only add a pip or two. So my  .05 are not .06 or .08 depending on the currency.

What we maybe facing is a mini collapse of the pound right now and if the ship does not right itself soon, you just have to take the loss and eat it. The gbp/jpy has just done a -1030 move with out a retrace and that is really really rare. It looks like it is going to retrace now, finally. I only need about a 240-250 retrace to break even on that one so that is doable. Exciting moments in Forex land.

--- 帖子 #385 ---
Yes that is exactly how to do it. You dont play with trades that have put you in the hole. If it did not break resistance and went back into its downtrend it would kill you. Now that all the trades have closed if the trend continues you can put a buy on the other side of the R line and benefit if it does break Resistance. If it doesnt you got out of your bad trade in good shape. So playing the market this way can create a Win Win for you. If price continues to go up, you pick up the trade just as it breaks the Resistance line, (a low risk trade in my opinion) and if it bounces off and goes back down, you got rid of a bad trade with very little damage or a small profit. So you played exactly by the book. That is how it is done.  After you have done this a couple of times your trading experience and confidence will soar and you will begin developing a trading patience because you will know exactly what you will do with price, whether it goes against you or for you. It is a good feeling.

The gbp/nzd is the most volatile currency of the big 8 (eur, chf, gbp, usd, jpy, aud, nzd, cad) without going to exotics so you will face this scenario more often with it than any other currency pair. If you want practice getting out of trouble that is the perfect currency to use. It will do long runs of 1500-2500 several times a year so if you want to trade that kind of excitement be my guest. I dont think I will play with it anymore.

Also, now that price action is picking up you will find more trades during the day than we did during the slower summer months. Good luck and glad to hear the good news.

It is just a matter of not overmargining your account or playing with too big of lots. I have learned to play those S/R lines. Entering and TP at those lines is the foundation of everything I try to do with my trading.

--- 帖子 #388 ---
[quote=nico28;3102463]
I would not use the 150 with the E/J but I will look into the 150 tonight and see what is wrong. You would try to handle the trade manually if there is a  problem. Turning on and off the computer should not affect the EA I would think since it still would register one live trade going.  Turning on and off the computer however does affect it closing trades. So if you closed a trade and turned it off and back on it would not know it is suppose to continue closing.

--- 帖子 #390 ---
[quote=nanningbob;3103306]
Why you would not recommend using 150 with EJ ?

when use 150, does that mean every 150 pip, the EA will enter next level when there is 3x3MA cross ?

So, as long as no 3x3 cross, 2nd position may end up enter say 300 or 400 pip away from 1st level enter ?

--- 帖子 #391 ---
[quote=nico28;3103481]
NO. once the first level is entered the EA will reenter every 150 pips from the first position. So a currency like EJ which can move 4-600 pips in one day, the 150 is not enough room. I always use the 200 with it.

--- 帖子 #392 ---
[quote=nanningbob;3103672]
I see. I though with the EA turn on, 2nd level will Only trigger when there is a 3x3 MA crossed ?

I read your few post saying you were save by the EA because as long as the 3x3 never cross, the EA will not trigger 2nd level or even 3rd level ?

Did I understand wrong ?

Thankyou, bob

--- 帖子 #393 ---
No 2nd and 3rd will reenter every "x" pips if not going your way.

I say "x" because u can set this to b what u want. (depending on particular pair)

What he was saying was that he turned the ea on and it never entered the 1st trade because of no cross. He was saying this is a plus because without the ea he would have entered manually to early. But because ea waits for 3 3 cross the trade was never opened in the first place

--- 帖子 #394 ---
Thankyou. So it is my misunderstanding. The 3x3 cross is only apply to 1st trade (entry)

2nd & 3rd levels entry is simply re-enter after "x" pip.

--- 帖子 #395 ---
Yes that is correct
