--- 帖子 #1059 ---
Hi Bob

I think your problem is with sell orders in mptm. I have just checked the mptm and I was getting the same problem as you (i.e. closing and part closing at the same time). I went back and read the instructions once again and it clearly states:

"BreakEvenProfit: will add this to the stop loss to a buy order, subtract it for a sell order. My default of 2 pips means the sl is set to break even + 2, ensuring a minimum of 2 pips profit. Set it to 0 if you do not want this feature."

For short orders Breakeven profit should be a minus value. I looked at the problem orders and they were all SHORTS. So I just changed the Breakeven profit to 0 and all working OK now. For ease of understanding and clarity I am atatching a picture of this section of the settings which is now working OK.

Kind regards

--- 帖子 #1060 ---
A little studie about the 25% lines:

In chart 1 we have the two horizontal lines drawn with the "NB Fourths" indicator.

Just a technical remark: the autor use the internal functions "WindowPriceMax(0)" and "WindowPriceMin(0)". This functions returns the upper and lower border values from the visible window, and not the HigherHigh and LowerLow prices!

Chart 2 has the same number of bars like chart1 (120 bars = ca. 1 month).

I programmed a little HighLow indicator to calculate the 25% lines. The indicator takes everytime the last 120 bars to calculate this lines.

(A nice option is to make the calculation with Open and Close, not only with High and Low).

If we compare the signals, we see that in chart1 on the left edge we have signals only in chart 2.

Now if we scroll the first chart, we see in chart 3 that at the moment who we have the days from 22.Jan on the right edge, the signals appear also in chart1.

Conclusion: if also the MACD were programmed to draw scaled values for the last 120 bars, than we can analyse correct the signals back!

The current versions for drawing the 25% lines and the MACD are valid only at the right edge of the charts.

.

--- 帖子 #1078 ---
Not completely useless, just open a second chart, for instance EURJPY, put the trade manager on that chart and set it to handle trades on that pair. So for instance you have one EURJPY chart with NanBob EA & one EURJPY chart with mptm EA. Do this for each pair you want to handle.

BTW Error 4008 does not interrupt program execution, so it may go away by itself as price moves. Can happen (I think) if price has moved beyond the setting the EA was trying to make. Technically it means that no value was assigned to the string being an operand in an expression.

Hope that helps ...

--- 帖子 #1084 ---
Hi,

A single instance of the MPTM EA can handle any of these scenarios:

Just the pair the EA is currently running on

All trades anywhere on the account

A selection of trades based on the magic number of the EA which created them
A selection of trades based on the comment field
A single trade based on the Ticket Number

The very latest addition which I have not yet tested adds another possibility being to manage a selection of trades based on the Symbol field (EURUSD, GBPJPY etc).

Also you can combine any of the above which are logical, so for instance you could manage only the pair the EA is on & then only trades created by a specific EA, by using it's magic number.

Hope this helps ...

p.s. Attached is the user manual for anyone who has not seen it

Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility.

I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin.[/quote]

--- 帖子 #1088 ---
This discussion happened on my other forum and it applies to the gold lines on why and how they work. So I thought I would copy and paste it here.

"I am a little confused here. Surely these new indicators draw lines that are based on the screen being viewed and ignore price. ie they simply split the screen up into equal segments So if I have a lesser no of bars on my screen than you do or if I magnify the display etc we will have different price entry points for trades etc Fibs and Pivots levels are based on calculations from price so will be the same no matter how the chart is displayed This would explain why you cannot back test it unless in visual mode ie Without a screen display how could the EA know what the levels were! I would have thought it better to base this new approach on price so everyone at least were singing from the same hymn sheet so to say

I see Swingman in your other thread has done an indicator along these lines Maybe we could use this as a basis Do you think this is in line with your new approach?

Best Regards"

You could but I use a 4H chart for almost all my trading. What you see on the screen is a 1 month period of price action therefore as price moves across the screen the movement of the gold lines are very slight over a period of a week. In reality they are just another form of moving average lines. If you change from a 4H chart to a 1H chart all indicators, all moving averages will change or move. You change the amount of time or information used for the calculations. These gold lines are a moving average of 1 month of price action but in instead of using candles it is the distance from the  top to the bottom or the range calculated by MT4 for that pair. This figure is based on MT4 figures of how much price has moved for a particular currency pair. MT4 uses this figure to give you your screen size. So the distance from top to bottom is a price range calculation. The gold lines are a moving average of that range. I am a range trader, to me this is perfect for my range trading systems. I hope you understood this, they are really another form of a moving average line. All indicators are, it is just the math is different.

--- 帖子 #1097 ---
A discussion on the other thread is helping me to define what the gold lines are. Here is some more information. Hope you enjoy.

When ever you change screen size you change levels. For example when you change from a 4H chart to a 1H chart, what are you really doing??? You are changing your screen size. 1H to 15M same thing. That changes all your indicators. It is the same thing. All these systems we have previously have one weakness and your chart shows this, You can get a sell while price is at the bottom of the screen and then as it goes north you are into the trade too early. These new lines can solve that problem. The lines are now fixed to the actual range of the particular currency instead of a set of numbers. When MT4 gives you a screen it is based on the range of the currency during that period of time. We are using that qualification as our foundation for trading. In other words MT4 has already done the work of the range of each currency. We use that math to determine the lines to trade from. Now that doesnt mean it does not create new weaknesses but we wont find out the new weaknesses until we get something consistent to test. What is hard to comprehend is your screen size is an indicator based on price action. That is why every currency has a different pip size for its screen. The usd/jpy from top to bottom is different from the gbp/jpy. WHY?? because the screen height is based on price action of the pair for the time period you are looking at. This maybe hard to fathom but your screen size is an indicator. http://cdn.forexfactory.com/images/s.../yim/happy.gif

--- 帖子 #1098 ---
We as human beings tend to overlook the simple and look for the complicated. the ethos being the more complicated the more accurate (which would also mean more mistakes). Therefore, the best things are the simple ones. The notion that your screen is an indicator and what it at th top and bottom quarter represents the extreems of moves within that range, is quite logical. I am baffled why we had not figured it out before.

Kind regards.

--- 帖子 #1100 ---
Here are the 4D and 5D versions of MPTM that have worked for me on IBFX. I will be using these on my live account starting Monday. They are the newest versions downloaded on 2-16. Let me know if you are having any problems with them. The settings are BreakEven EA break even after 20 pips. The jump EA breaks even at 20 and then moves the stop every 25 pips. So at 50 pips you secure a 25 pips profit at 75 pips you secure a 50 pip profit. I put NB in the titles to show these are the ones that go with my system, it is never meant to take any credit for Steve's work which I think is fantastic.

--- 帖子 #1101 ---
OK these are version EAs 3.1 I have changed some of them. 01 and 02 series are for non ECN and 03 and 04 are for ECN dealers. Also corrected a couple of more mistakes made in the code. This also solves my closing at the wrong time when I enter a 2nd level. When you use the 02 or 04 series for the 2nd level you have removed the 01, 03 series EA from your screen and the TP at the green line is no longer active. If you have a non ECN account the 03 and 04 series EAs will still work. If you have an ECN account the 01 and 02 series EAs should not work.

·The 101 and the 201 (except pink EAs) enter from the white outside lines and take profit at the green line.
·The 102 and the 202 (except pink EAs) enter from the white outside lines and have no take profit at the green line.
·101,102,201,202 all have take profit and stop loss settings placed at the time of the trade.
·103,203,104,204 are for ECN dealers. They have no stop loss or take profit settings.
·The 103 and 203 series have no SL or TP and are used with ECN MT4 dealers. They will close the trade at the green line.
·The 104 and 204 series have no SL, TP or Green line profit. All they do is enter the trade, you manage the trade after that.
·The numbers are also the magic number for each EA.
·Any EAs with pink in its name enters on the cross of the pink line instead of the white line.

dont forget to save the new EAs to your template or you will get the old setup.

--- 帖子 #1108 ---
Hi Bob

I have been thinking about getting better entry in your system. No doubt what I am going to ask has been analyzed by you before and please forgive me if this is a repetition. Just wanted to have your thoughts and reasoning.

The first thought was to have gradual entry (i.e. if going for 0.08 lots in total, entering 0.02 every 50 pips of negative movement). I came to the conclusion that this would not be compatible with the 2-4-2 recovery.

The second thought looks attractive to me and I will be trying it for a period and report back to you. In the meantime your input would be gratefully appreciated. Oh I forgot the idea is when the conditions are right for entry instead of immediate entry or using the EA, to put a PENDING order of say 25 pips difference (e.g. if the system indicates a long entry at price of 0.1500, a pending order for 0.1525 is placed). If the retrace happens at that point we are worse off by 25 pips. However, if it does not we could trail it by every 25 pips. This way we will have lower DD and higher profits when the retrace happens.

I hope I have made myself understood and I have an inkling that you are going to say this is a daft idea; if possible I want to know why.

Kind Regards

--- 帖子 #1111 ---
I am sorry if I did not explain properly. The whole point is to reduce DD and hence Margin. This is only for the initial entry only. Once position is open everything is done according to the system. Pending order MAY (with a big emphasis on MAY) help to reduce DD. For instance when the conditions are right for a long entry instead of instant execution we place a pending order 25 pips above the present price if after 8 hours price has gone done by 50 pips we move the pending order 50 pips lower and so on. Once the retrace starts and the price starts going up our order is triggered.

I hope I managed to get m point across.

Kind regards

--- 帖子 #1112 ---

The actual value of the MACD doesn't change, just its visual representation on the screen.

--- 帖子 #1115 ---
The 3x3 can still be used. I had a trade I thought I missed the low so I put on the 3x3 and it entered a nice trade for me. (GBP/USD) The mptm has move me up to guaranteed 40 pip profit so its a nice trade now. I have turned off the MPTM because the SL is now just below the S/R line. So if price retraces back down I have my profit if it continues up it wont close out the trade early on a retrace.  If price did continue to go down and not enter off of the 3x3 then I could put the low EA on again and get a deeper entrance. I may develop an EA that does either/or, enter at 3x3 cross or the deepest low/high. Once I am at the bottom 10-15% of the screen I want to get my best entrance but I do want my entrance. There is a lot of flexibility here.

Thank you for your contributions to the thread . Using the earlier version of the manager, can you tell me if my settings are correct if I want to close .01 lots of a .02 lot trade when I'm up 50 pips and trail the remaining .01 lot by 20 pips? I have BE set to true, BE pips set to 50, BE profit set to 30, partial close enabled set to true, close lots set to.01, preserve lots set to .01, trailing stop set to true, trailing stop pips set to 20 .   thank you

--- 帖子 #1136 ---
Not quite -

Think should be:

BreakEven=true

BreakEvenPips=50 (500 if you are on a 5 digit borker)

BreakEvenProfit=0

PartCloseEnabled=true

Close_Lots=0.01

Preserve_Lots=0.01

TrailingStop=true

TrailingStopPips=20 (200 if you are on a 5 digit borker)

TrailAfterBreakevenOnly=true

As usual no guarantees

Best of luck

--- 帖子 #1137 ---
thanks much mac.

--- 帖子 #1138 ---

I have not tested the trailing stop yet because I am working with the jump start so my first question is does it work well? Second question, when it closes a trade will it close all the trades of that currency pair or just that one trade. I know I am having trouble with my EAs closing all the trades when I only want it to close one. That is why I am using different Magic numbers but it does not seem to be working out that way. The issue I am facing at this point is the MPTM works great when you have one trade going on a pair but when I get into multiple levels I am not sure it is working properly. Do you have any advice or experience using it in this area.

--- 帖子 #1139 ---
IMHO a jumping stop gives better results than a trailing stop - both routines work fine.

The MPTM handles each trade individually, including any hedge trades it opens. For instance in my manual trading I will often have 6 trades open, 3 buy & 3 sell and each is handled individually according to the rules set for that currency pair. The hedge trades are opened by the MPTM, at a set pip loss.

Hope that helps ...

--- 帖子 #1148 ---
I'm a bit confused now, is this ea only managing trades opend by the 3x3 EA or is it also opening trades based on the 25% golden lines? If it's only a managing EA why not combine them the 3x3 EA to one EA? Is anyone using them both one on one chart and one on the other same pair TF chart?

If have had the mptm ea on a few charts for a week.... (no action at all) .

--- 帖子 #1149 ---
mptm does not open trades, it only manages the SL line. It brings the SL line ot break even after 20 pips and if you use the Jump MPTM it will move the SL line up every 25 pips. You only enter trades when you turn on the EA. The EA only enters when price crosses. If you use the 3x3 then a trade is entered at the cross. If you use the 100 or 200 series EAs the EA enters when price crosses the white or pink lines depending on which one you use. We tested version 3 here but when I finalized it I moved it on to a new thread because it bacame a trend following system. This thread will continue to be a countertrend system.

--- 帖子 #1171 ---
Just to let you know, I am changing from my 3x3 to a 6x6. I have demo tested it the last week and compared to the High/low system and the 3x3 system and it had the lowest DD and fewer false entrances. Here are the pics to compare. Just change it to 6 median LWMA 0 for one line and 6 Median LWMA shift 1 for the other line. Most of the week it was in the green and went very little in the red. Here are pics to compare. First pic is the 6x6 and the second is the old 3x3.

--- 帖子 #1172 ---
Put the 2 6x6 ML in your expert advisor folder. THe 6x6tpl in the template folder. The rest go in the indicators folder. It is simple. When price goes above the yellow 1/4 of the screen put on the sell EA and when price goes to the 1/4 bottom of the screen put on the buy. I will let you make your own buy and sell screens. Very simple screen. I also use the MPTM Universal BE and I had only one trade go into DD of more than 100 pips in my tests. So test it out but I will be using this instead of all the others. If it works out I will remove all the other EAs on page 1 and will go with just this one. Then I will see how I can use this as a trend following down the road since it doesnt look like it will have the problems we encountered on the other thread. Happy trading.

--- 帖子 #1173 ---
Yes I think I will. I also think the 6x6 will solve my peek in trades I often got with the 3x3. I set my MPTM to 15 pips and BE with a 5 pip  profit and all week long it worked for me. If price goes 15 and back up it profits 5. If it goes back down again it will reenter but if it keeps going back up it wont on the buy EA. Same thing with the sell.

--- 帖子 #1177 ---
I put the MPTM on one unused chart and it manages all my trades. My internet is down at my house so I cant post results until later today. Sorry. Yes I am older today, dang. The rules for the 6x6 are the same as the 3x3. I just feel it will miss some of those peeker trades and if you eyeball the crosses you will almost always get a 20 pip movement on a 4H chart. I have noticed this in my demo trading. The 3x3 would enter and then price move against you but on the same trade the 6x6 would not enter. If the 6x6 does enter it almost always gets 20 pips and sets the BE with the MPTM. Only one time did it not do this. SO the DD seems to be much less. Well I have to go back and teach. Only get 10 minute break each hour.

primary trades

Secondary trades
BUYS eur/cad,
SELLS  aud/jpy, aud/usd, chf/jpy, eur/jpy, eur/usd, nzd/jpy, nzd/usd,

OK my top 11 pairs and alternates:

This gives me 2 of each: aud, cad, chf, gbp, nzd,

4 of each eur, usd, jpy

aud/cad - aud/nzd this matches minor or commodity currencies together. As I have stated before minor currencies can get squashed by the larger currencies.

chf/jpy - eur/jpy - eur/usd - eur/cad - eur/nzd

gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy

Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility.        __________________

I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.

OK my top 11 pairs and alternates:

This gives me 2 of each: aud, cad, chf, gbp, nzd,

4 of each eur, usd, jpy
aud/cad - aud/nzd this matches minor or commodity currencies together. As I have stated before minor currencies can get squashed by the larger currencies.
chf/jpy - eur/jpy - eur/usd - eur/cad - eur/nzd
gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy
Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility.        __________________

I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.[/quote]

--- 帖子 #1182 ---
The NZD/CHF is an interesting trade between the gold lines. I am taking it because the NZD/USD and the NZD/JPY are primary trades above the line so I am going to play all three to move south. It also has a set of railroad tracks which is a good sign for a reversal. See what happens. I put both pics up to show you why. NZD/USD is a classic primary trade and I take the NZD/CHF as an almost primary trade with it. NZD/JPY is also a classic primary trade now and the 6x6 has entered it as such.

--- 帖子 #1183 ---
Back to the aud/jpy trade. It was a primary trade that did not move enough pips to set the mptm. So we try for a better entrance this time. Pink arrow shows the first entrance. This is now a secondary trade, same signal as the earlier primary trade but now showing divergance. I like divergance trades because you usually will get more pips than a primary trade.

--- 帖子 #1184 ---
Divergance is pink line on MACD showing lower highs and the chart white line showing higher highs. This is showing loss of momentum of the upward price movement. Good signal that price is reversing. Also green line on chart shows a nice double top on the highs another indicator that price is reversing and upward movement is exhausted for now. Of course we realize that none of this is guaranteed but they are good signs.

--- 帖子 #1185 ---
Interesting approach. I take it you're setting the step to a lower number to get EA to reenter at next cross.? How are you setting the trade manager to handle the second level trade. Because if you let it set on Manage All Trades, won't it kick out the L2 trade too early?

--- 帖子 #1186 ---
Yes I am using the MPTM and each level has a different Magic number. So the step is at the cross and is caused by a seperate EA. So if the MPTM closes out a trade it doesnt close all the trades because the entrances each have a different magic number. So it will only close one trade at a time. So far I have had 19 - 5 pip trades which equals to almost 100 pips. kind of interesting. Will report in the morning/your evening. I am also testing the 6x6 with the trend trading system and am getting the results I thought I would get with the high low system. I want to run for a period of time on a demo though before I roll it out htis time. I want to make sure it really works. The theory is matched by performance.

--- 帖子 #1189 ---
Bob,

I'm not following you. Right now I have the manager set to manage all trades( which overrides all other settings) bringing them to BE + 5 pips after reaching 20 pips positive. If a L2 trade kicks in won't the manager treat it the same as the ongoing L1 trades and  set it to BE +5 also. That wouldn't be good.    Second  question- If I have max trades set to 3 and pips set to 200 on the 6x6 EA, will the EA wait for the price to go against me 200 pips and enter there or will it wait for the 200 step and enter at the next MA cross? thanks

--- 帖子 #1190 ---
If price backs up on the second trade and takes the +5 yes it is good because then you wont have a second DD trade. When price recrosses and enters again then you are in a better trade  position.

One EA will reenter every 200 pips, if you use a second EA later with a different magic number then it will reenter at the cross. Since the EAs have different magic number the MPTM will handle them as separate trades not as one. If one closes the other does not. If it is the same ea when one trade closes so will the other.

--- 帖子 #1191 ---
I dont know if anyone has done that and it is doable, little complicated but will look at it.  Actually that question should be in the 60x90 thread.

--- 帖子 #1194 ---
This and the next post show my trades(except for a few manual trades using another strategy) for the last four trading days  using the 6x6. Closed a couple down before TP was reached. I turned on the EA's when price crossed the fourths line regardless of where Red,White and Blue were. I traded dimes on 20 pairs minus the GBP/JPY. I set TP to 50 and used the trade manager to bring trade to BE +5 when up 20 pips. Deciding when to turn EA's off was the thing. In general I turned them off after they opened a trade if 50 pips was going to put me back over the fourths line going in the opposite direction. So in total, I had 28 trades that retraced back to BE +5 for a total of 140 pips. Then 6 trades that went the 50 pips and TP'd. for another 300 pips. So total trades gave 440 pips for the four days. I likes what I see. No L2 trades needed yet although I have the EUR/CHF set to reenter at the next MA cross.

--- 帖子 #1197 ---
Bob,

My post #613 on this thread shows changes needed to stop reentry after a TP. I'm not sure if these changes will prevent reentry after a stop(retrace to BE) is hit but I think it does. The thing is that you want EA to reenter sometimes so that would be  something if you could come up with a filter. Maybe a filter that would allow reentry until white stoch or RSI reaches other extreme might be good. Here is post 613.bool YesStop;
bool isTPSL=False;

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

//| expert initialization function |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

int init()

{

//----

//----

return(0);

}

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

//| expert deinitialization function |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

int deinit()

{

//----

DeleteAllObjects();

//----

return(0);

}

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

//| expert start function |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

int start()

{

//----

int cnt=0;

bool result;

string text="";

string version="VERSI INI DAH EXPIRED...SILA YM xxul_gunturean utk  penggantian";

// skrip masa trading

if (UseTradingHours)

{

YesStop = true;

if (lotsi<0.01) lotsi=0.01;

if (lotsi>100) lotsi=100;

OpenOrders=0;

MarketOpenOrders=0;

LimitOpenOrders=0;

for(cnt=0;cnt<OrdersTotal();cnt++)

{

if (OrderSelect(cnt, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES))

{

if (OrderSymbol()==Symbol() && OrderMagicNumber() ==  MagicNumber)

{

if (OrderType()==OP_BUY || OrderType()==OP_SELL)

{

MarketOpenOrders++;

LastOrderOpenTime=OrderOpenTime();

}

if (OrderType()==OP_SELLLIMIT || OrderType()==OP_BUYLIMIT)  LimitOpenOrders++;

OpenOrders++;

}

}

}
if(PreviousOpenOrders>OpenOrders) isTPSL=True;

if (OpenOrders<1)

{

if (!TradeOnFriday && DayOfWeek()==5)

{

Comment("TradeOnfriday is False");

return(0);

}

}

...................................  ...................................   ..........

}

if (PreviousOpenOrders>OpenOrders)

{

ContinueOpening = false;

for(cnt=OrdersTotal()-1;cnt>=0;cnt--)

{

if (OrderSelect(cnt, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES))

{

mode=OrderType();

if ((OrderSymbol()==Symbol() && OrderMagicNumber() ==  MagicNumber) || AllSymbolsProtect)

{

if (mode==OP_BUY || mode==OP_SELL)

{

OrderClose(OrderTicket(),OrderLots( ),OrderClosePrice(),slippage,Arrows   Color);

return(0);

}

}

}

}

for(cnt=0;cnt<OrdersTotal();cnt++)

{

if (OrderSelect(cnt, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES))

{

mode=OrderType();

if ((OrderSymbol()==Symbol() && OrderMagicNumber() ==  MagicNumber) || AllSymbolsProtect)

{

if (mode==OP_SELLLIMIT || mode==OP_BUYLIMIT || mode==OP_BUYSTOP ||  mode==OP_SELLSTOP)

{

OrderDelete(OrderTicket());

return(0);

}

}

}

}

}

PreviousOpenOrders=OpenOrders;

if (OpenOrders>=MaxTrades)

{

ContinueOpening=False;

} else {

ContinueOpening=(isTPSL==False);

}

Delete the next line and bracket  http://cdn.forexfactory.com/images/buttons/quote.gif

Bob,

This will help us decide while back testing exactly where a trade kicked in and wether price then moved far enough to get a BE set. Will let you know if anyone comes up with something.

--- 帖子 #1203 ---
Don't think they'll be able to create an indicator because we're using the median price but I had a little brain storm that should get us close to the exact price at cross. Run the EA through the strategy tester and see where the trade was made. Take a guess where this cross(fx solutions platform) occurred.

--- 帖子 #1204 ---
Tester says 163.21 Attached Image (click to enlarge)

So I know I would have been safe with a buy here and a BE at +20.

--- 帖子 #1205 ---
I am not quite sure what you are asking? Your ticket when it enters gives you the entrance price and time. The high or low of a candle would give you the most extreme price so you can check to see if it went the x # of pips. The NB exposure or iexposure indicator gives you the entrance price and the sell/buy line on your screen gives you the entrance price with the spread included. In back testing there is an arrow on the screen giving price and entrance and you would have to manually check it against the high and low. However, backtesting will use higher and higher TF the farther back in time you go so the less accurate the entrance price would be. Back testors dont use the variable spreads so they are not that accurate for what you what I think. Eye ball backtesting actually will give you the best results in this case if you want to stare at the screen all day.

--- 帖子 #1206 ---
Bob,

I'm talking about looking back at 6x6 crossings, not present trades being made. Present trades show the entrance price,yes but if you look back say a year and see a cross, you can't tell exactly at what price the cross happened. You can eyeball some crosses and guess pretty closely what the price was at cross but if you get a cross on a long candle like in the chart I posted above, you have no idea. I may be wrong but I think the tester will be more accurate than trying to eyeball a cross like the one I posted above.

--- 帖子 #1207 ---
I think if you put a +20 TP it will tell if it hits the TP or not. Of course this will only count for the first trade because the EA will reenter and that info will do you no good after that. My eyeball testing and demo live testing showed me you get fewer false entrances as compared to the 3x3 but you will still get some misses. Dont think you will ever undo that, you will always get some.

--- 帖子 #1208 ---
My belief is that all EAs use indicators and all indicators do not predict news stories or strong fundamentals and need monitoring or human intervention. No matter what indicators we use sooner or later the market will move in a way that will defeat them. Having some knowledge of fundamentals is important to Forex trading. For example, If Greece files bankruptcy or the USA and China get into a pissing match over exchange rates, no indicator can predict the outcome or change of direction either when or how much. Indicators have limitations and if you understand those limitations they are valuable tools in trading. For example, if Greece goes bankrupt sell Euros no matter what the indicators are saying.

--- 帖子 #1209 ---
All I'm saying is, if you run this EA through the tester( and I agree it's not completely accurate) it tells you there was a cross at 163.21 on that candle in Aug. of 08 and price moved far enough to set a BE with a BE at +20 setting. I'd have no idea what price was at cross by eyeballing it. I'm really liking this 6x6 setting in conjunction with the trade manager. Great work Bob.

--- 帖子 #1212 ---
I changed the +5 to +10 and reenter every 20 instead of 15 to see how it would do. Picked up a nice 100 pips.  I have discovered a problem and not sure how to fix it. When you have a 2nd level trade and it goes for the +10 on the MPTM the EA on L2 will also close the 1st level trade. So the Eur/aud and eur/usd trade closed the 1st level trade when it closed the 2nd level trade of +10. Then it opened a new trade (the new trade is not a problem but closing the first level trade is). Now if you enter the 2nd level and turn the EA off you dont have the problem because with the MPTM you will only close one trade but with the EA on it will close both trades. Will have to see if I can solve that problem. So I had a losing day even though under normal conditions I would not have. Right now I will have to turn the mptm off during 2nd level trades or turn the EA off but sometimes I am not there during the 2nd level entrance and TP on the MPTM. The MPTM is not the problem but the EA is. You can see the EUR/NZD I was able to turn off the EA and the MPTM did score a +10 without closing the 1st level trade.

4 of each eur, usd, jpy
aud/cad - aud/nzd this matc hes minor or commodity currencies together. As I have stated before minor currencies can get squashed by the larger currencies.
chf/jpy - eur/jpy - eur/usd - eur/cad - eur/nzd
gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy
Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility. __________________
I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.

Sorry guys overslept and have to teach first thing. I will report later today.

That wont be the system fault but using the MPTM will get more complicated. It will probably mean using more MPTM than one. Each one using a different magic number. So level 1 will have magic number of 11 and you will need an mptm for it and 2nd level magic number will be 12 and you will need a mptm for it. I hope I wont need to do that. The mptm is giving me pip bonus every day.

--- 帖子 #1215 ---
Hi Bob,

You must delete the follwing passage in the 6x6-EA:

if (PreviousOpenOrders>OpenOrders)

{

for(cnt=OrdersTotal()-1;cnt>=0;cnt--)

{

if (OrderSelect(cnt, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES))

{

mode=OrderType();

if ((OrderSymbol()==Symbol() && OrderMagicNumber() == MagicNumber) || AllSymbolsProtect)

{

if (mode==OP_BUY || mode==OP_SELL)

{

OrderClose(OrderTicket(),OrderLots(),OrderClosePrice(),slippage,ArrowsColor);

return(0);

}

}

}

}

for(cnt=0;cnt<OrdersTotal();cnt++)

{

if (OrderSelect(cnt, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES))

{

mode=OrderType();

if ((OrderSymbol()==Symbol() && OrderMagicNumber() == MagicNumber) || AllSymbolsProtect)

{

if (mode==OP_SELLLIMIT || mode==OP_BUYLIMIT || mode==OP_BUYSTOP || mode==OP_SELLSTOP)

{

OrderDelete(OrderTicket());

return(0);

}

}

}

}

This passage is responsible for the multiple close of all open trades with the same Symbol and MagicNumber!!

If you delete that Closing-Part of the EA it will only open trades and do not close any trade.

With the MPTM-EA you can use the "ManageByTicketNumber" instead of "ManageByMagicNumber".

aiti

The Eur/NZD went 2nd level and then the 2nd level at 2 MPTM closes at +10 and now is 40 some pips to the good. I am really beginning to love this MPTM. It punishes brokers that like going after SL. --- 帖子 #1221 ---
I can see where the MPTM would limit the high low system. Price retracing to a high would not be as frequent as returning to a 6x6 cross. Price reenters after a TP on the 6x6 but it would have to go above the high/low again on the high/low system.

I lost a lot of money learning how to deal with bad trades but now I think I am pretty good at getting out of trouble.

I do like H4 trading and appreciate the good logic of exceeding and re-entering the MA 40 outer Bol. band.

Also trying to make my peace with the 2.4.2, not that I doubt it works, but my discomfort with such large (temporary) negatives.  That's totally my problem.

Still, I am surprised you need to go the the 2.4.2 too often.  Perhaps over your months of trading you really haven't.

If you get tired of praise, well, time to move on because like so many before me I thank you for your astonishing efforts on your forums with their voluminous detail and careful working out of things.

--- 帖子 #1238 ---
I am not quite sure which EA you are referring too. Even though we used BB bands at the beginning we have switched to dividing the screens into thirds now. DD seems to be something I cant avoid unless you use stop losses. Basically my stop loss is after it crosses 400 deep. I seldom have to use it maybe once or twice a month, I think I had one month with 3. The other side is I keep making these profits almost every day. THe problem is I dont know which currency will trend like crazy and usually every month one will. This time it is the JPY last time it was the GBP. Before that I think it was the EURO. If I could ever figure out which currency was going to do that every month it would be a perfect world for me. Despite all of that the DD prevents me from overextending myself with too large of lot size and now I dont wipe out accounts like I did years ago. So it has been a good lesson for me. Thanks for the compliment, I only publish what I have learned and I have never been able to keep my profits trend trading. To much whiplash and to many stop losses. At least this way, as you can see over the months, I have been able to be profitable. Good luck and I hope I have helped you.

SELLS

OK my top 11 pairs and alternates:
This gives me 2 of each: aud, cad, chf, gbp, nzd,
4 of each eur, usd, jpy
aud/cad - aud/nzd this matc hes minor or commodity currencies together. As I have stated before minor currencies can get squashed by the larger currencies.
chf/jpy - eur/jpy - eur/usd - eur/cad - eur/nzd
gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy
Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility. __________________
I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.[/quote][/quote][/quote]

I still don't know about using the manager for second level trades. This has happened to me already where I'd now be out of both level trades.

--- 帖子 #1245 ---
I´m testing a 6x6-EA which open the first level.Instead of opening the second level at 150 pips the EA change the magicnumber +1 if price reach the 150-pips.So you have only first level-trades.

If you have a trend your "second" trade will not open at 150 pips but only if you have the 6x6-cross.In long trending currencies you get wider pip-spacing.

aiti

--- 帖子 #1248 ---
I keep 3 buy EAs and 3 sell EAs with different Magic numbers. THis way the entrance is only made at the cross and not a predetermined pip number. When the MPTM closes a 2nd level trade, because it has a different Magic number it doesnt affect the other levels. When the 2nd level requalifies as a trade it will reenter the trade. So I pick up a half a dozen or so MTPM trades every day. Yesterday was a no mover day but I picked up 80 pips from it bouncing around the 2nd and 3rd level areas. It is working out very well. The MPTM works well with a MA cross system but does not seem to work well with a high/low system.

Bob,

How do you keep both of these EA's from entering at the same next cross?

--- 帖子 #1251 ---
I've altered my code to prevent EA's from reentering after a TP or SL is hit. Reentering has gotten me into too many trades I didn't want to be in. Changes can be found on post #613 of this thread.

--- 帖子 #1252 ---
Too close maybe a problem, too far is not. I am testing a sixths EA with 5 lines on the screen so it adjusts to each currency. When price enters between two of the lines I make sure I dont get my second level unless it is in a different zone. So in the pic below of the aud/chf you can see level 1 (the white #1) and the second level (white #2). This is what I am using to keep my spacing with the different levels. So instead of a fixed number I am using what ever is the range of that currency. So I want trades to have the distance from one line to the next to be my spacing. In this trade my 3rd level would actually be a spot that is not even on the screen right now.  I also am thinking of beyond top/bottom red line being my entrance area for  volatile currencies and red to gold for others. I am also planning on writing a high/low and 6x6 cross EA. You only turn it on in the red area so you get your entrance at a high/low or if it doesnt it also enters at the cross. The red to gold area you only use the 6x6 cross. This will give you spacing designed for every currencies range rather than just 150 or 200. For example the gbp/nzd spacing is closer to 250 or 300 while the aud/chf spacing is around 100. So this will put everything together with simple rules for each area. If price is above red line use this EA #1 which will be a high/low or 6x6 (maybe the old 3x3) cross EA. if between the gold and red, use EA #2 which will be a 6x6 EA. When price goes against you the distance between two lines put on the 2nd Level EA for your 2ne entrance. Just some ideas I am working on. This will put all our latest ideas together into an easy to understand and usable system. Not so comlicated. See pic below:

--- 帖子 #1253 ---

For example the EUR/JPY has closed 8 trades in two days. 4 MPTM 2 for nice profit. One level break even and one for a small loss. That brings me back to only 2 levels on that pair but a pile of pips in the bank. So I want the reentrance. Those multiple MPTM hits are adding up. I am having a really big day so far today.

--- 帖子 #1267 ---
Same indicator but I change the colors last night. You have the one with the previous colors. Same indicator though.

MPTM is a separate EA from the 6x6. The MPTM manages all your trades and you put it on a separate screen all by itself. Go to Steve Hopwoods thread and he will explain all mechanics behind it.
http://www.forexfactory.com/showthread.php?t=89371

In other words there is a thread dedicated to just explaining all of its functions. I just use the BE part with a TP of +10. So when the 6x6 enters a trade the MPTM will manage it. If price moves more than 20 pips it will set a TP of 10 as the SL. If it hits the SL of +10 it closes the trade. If the 6x6 is still crossed as a trade, it will then enter a new trade and start the process all over again. If you are in the same candle this is always true. The 6x6 will open another trade. If you are in a new candle and it retraces back to the +10 SL but it also uncrosses the 6x6 then it wont enter a new trade.

--- 帖子 #1268 ---
Thanks.   I guessed it must be the same.

--- 帖子 #1269 ---
Toothman I think a good time to turn on the HIGH/LOW ea is when price is near those lines. You then have the ability to predict a great entrance point which I think was missing in that system.

--- 帖子 #1270 ---
Ok I figured out the problem with the MPTM and the AUD/NZD trade. It was the same magic number. The EA had entered a 2nd level under the same magic number so when the mptm closed the +10 it also closed the 1L trade. So I changed all my reentries to 1000 so it wont reenter. I will handle reentries manually by putting on a 2L, 3L, EAs that have a different magic number. So I am adding that to my list.

I was talking about Oct. of 2008 not Oct. the 8th. Specifically around the 22nd-24th. Knowing you ,you may have been able to wiggle out of trouble. But it looks to me like on the 23rd if you reentered another buy trade(after a BE+10), price would then have gone against you 2000 pips without hardly any retrace. You may have used the 2,4,2 on the way down a couple times but at some point you would have to give up on the trade with some hefty losses.It's possible profits from other trades at the time could have balanced out these losses, I don't know. If you wouldn't have reentered on the 23rd (after a BE+10), buy EA would have kicked in on the 26th and again on the 27th and resulted in wins.

--- 帖子 #1274 ---
After a stop or TP by the manager, EA will automatically open another buy if 6MA (shift 0) is above 6MA(shift 1) and the opposite for sell. After the manager stops or TP's a trade I have been waiting for the shift 0 to go back under the shift 1 before I put the buy EA on again . Opposite for sells.

--- 帖子 #1276 ---
My philosophy is a little differetn. Even though no one desires DD my feelings are I can bring any DD back to zero if I am patient enough and chip away at it over time. If you have noticed I have already 0 out the eur/jpy and chf/jpy DD and now I will work on the aud/jpy and gbp/jpy DD. Instead of taking losses I use my profits and countertrades to eliminate them over a period of time. This is very hard to teach and to get others to understand but I am hoping over a period of time and by daily example you can see how I do that.

My feelings on SL are you end up beating your head against the wall trying to make profit because I always seem to take enough SL to never get anywhere. My first two years of trading were like that. Make some money, lose it with SL and then going into the hole and then trying to catch back up to break even. Very frustrating. Got tired of that game. Maybe I am a little arrogant but I now believe I can take any DD and over time zero it out which means I will always keep my profits. It is a trading skill that takes time to develop. If you can make money using SL be my guest but I prefer to zero out my DD. So you can watch me do it with this latest DD.

I do use manual SL but it is around 4-500 pips. I get 1-3 of those a month as an average. 1 so far this month.

--- 帖子 #1282 ---
They are trades that meet my definitions from my booklet, pg 1 post 1. What it means is I turn on the EA and it makes my entrance. If price does not retrace that means I will not be entering that trade. All my trades start when the EA enters at the cross. There are times I will enter manually at a S/R line but that is a rare event.

Bob's original 6x6 version along with the trade manager as he said will reenter after a TP or retrace to BE + . He's doing quite well with it and certainly gets more trades reentering. I may go back to this version but for now I've altered it to not reenter. I don't like how price can end up in the middle of the chart after a TP and then reopen another trade. You can wake up in the morning after a nice TP and already be down several pips on a new trade. Of course with the right price action you could be up several pips. So far for the month, I'm up 330 pips with a DD of 874. Worst DD during that period was around 1400.

--- 帖子 #1291 ---
The 6x6 posted is the only one right now. I have not made any changes to the basic EA except to TP at 100 pips. Right now I am reentering after a MPTM and that is working great. The only thing I may work on this weekend is no more entrances after a certain amount of pips from the cross. For example if it takes the 100 pip profit I dont want it to reenter again. The reenters off of the MPTM dont bother me because I want to be in the trade. This is the philosophy: when the 6 crosses the 6 I want to be in the trade. If price bounces around a bit and hits a couple of MPTM TP that is ok with me. that is what I want. Sometimes price action is in the mud and this bouncing up and  down is perfect for the MPTM. At least I capture something. If price goes against me than I wait for the next level entrance and away we go again. I dont mind the DD as much as other people. That is because I have had a lot of practice using the 2.4.2 recovery system and have gotten good at it. So no amount of DD bothers me. I also will add more money to my account if it passes the 20% mark.  So if DD is more than 20% of my account I will add money to keep it out of trouble. This is working out real well for me.

--- 帖子 #1294 ---
Sorry I havent had a chance to answer all your comments. Love dealing with fellow educators, they seem to have the patience to learn the business and able to deal with its ups and downs. I guess much like teaching students in school. I have been in China almost 8 years now and the language is very difficult. My children picked it up but I have just a child's ability to speak it. Mainly my problem is I dont really need to use it here. I am one of the few foreigners here with an American wife (married 35 years this June) so I only speak English at  home. I teach in a local Chinese Medical University so they only want me to speak English there. I have my school for foreign children so they only speak English there, I am the administrator but my wife is the boss (principal, she runs the place I just make sure we are legal and the bills are paid). I have learned enough to survive on the streets, buy things, take taxis, trips, and do some small talk. Chinese is a tonal language and it took three years for my ears to pick up the different tones. MA, MA , MA and MA are four different words in Chinese depending on the  tone you use with the sound. So if you dont hear the tone you have no idea what they are saying and if you dont speak the correct tone they have no idea what you are saying. One tone MA means horse, another tone means mother, another tone means hemp ................. so I am sorry but I didnt mean I wanted to smoke your mother or No I didnt mean to call your mother a horse .......... and so on. Since I teach in a University they speak the common Mandarin taught in the schools but out on the streets they speak a form of Cantonese called Nanning Hua here. If you go to another town like BeiHai they will speak BeiHai Hua. So even though Cantonese is the language of the area in the cities, each city has its own version. Then when you get into the countryside you got all the dialects and each village will have its own versions of each dialect. There is Zhuang, Miao, Yao, etc. etc. One of the reasons China has not been a unified country in its past is it never really had a national language until Mao set up a standard Mandarin and then had all the schools teach the same language. He also unified the written language into a simpler form so it could be taught nationwide. We are now seeing the rise of a powerful country because of these improvements. Before this language prevented the Chinese from being a unified group of people and as their history books attest the foreigners took advantage of the situation. So China has never really been able to expand outside of its borders without a unified language. Well enough talk, back to trading.

For these transactions, the MA shift 0 is still under shift 1 that is why EA opened a new transaction. Do you reenter and what is the signal for you to reenter while shift 0 still under shift 1. (NOT cross up and cross down again, i understand you reenter when cross up and cross down again)

--- 帖子 #1296 ---
OK first it is working exactly the way it is suppose to work Price is entering and price retracing is causing you to get your +5. It did this 4 times. I use +10 and got it 2 times. Price then retraced and it is for now a negative trade. I got the same thing. Without the MPTM the EA would have entered and you would still be in a negative trade. You would have 0 pips in the bank and the broker still got his 5 pips for the spread. However, now you are in a negative trade but have 20 pips in the bank just like me. For me that happen 19 times yesterday and I put in the bank 190 pips. Without the MPTM I would not have had the 190 pips but much less. I only had 134 pips on non MPTM trades. Here is the only rule in trading that matters. How much money did the broker cut you this month? You cant have your broker cut you a check unless you have money going into the bank (closed trades). So go to your 4H chart and take a look at the aud/jpy for the week. It had two cross downs or two profitable trades if taken for the week. I was having trouble with my internet so I didnt get the first one but I did get the 2nd trade for 38 pips. That would have been my week without the MPTM. However, with it I also got 12 +10 for 120 pips making my week pocketed 158 pips just on one pair. With just the cross you enter make a profit and exit. With the MPTM you also pick up some pips with the bouncing around. Yes it reenters when it is in the same candle but if price is not going anywhere it may not reenter after that. The only thing that matters to me is what am I putting in the bank and the rest is how can I zero out this trade and go on. How much money the broker gets is irrelevant? He is in business for the same reason I am. I want him to make money so he stays in business and my money is safe. So for the 13 trades I made 138 pips. Aud/jpy spread is 5 pips so he made 65 pips. Compare that with I made 38 pips and he made 5 pips. I will gladly take the 138 and he can have his 65. We both win.

--- 帖子 #1297 ---
Here is another way of looking at it. I entered my first level trade back on March 22 with the aud/jpy. I am 3 weeks into this series of trades. Long time to hang in there. I have had 21 closed trades and 3 open trades. My DD at this point is 726 which is very high, dont have that happen often but it happens. 18 of my closed trades are MPTM; 15 are +10; 3 are +5 for 165 pips. I had two other profit trades of 61 and 50 for 111 and one losing trade closed at -14 for a total of 97 non mptm trades. 97 + 165 Total 262 pips in the bank. 726 DD - 262 (inthe bank) = 500. With 3 open trades on the board I need 166 pip retracement to break even pip wise, however with the larger lots as I reenter it is closer to 100 pips to break even. I will enter a 4th level Monday at the R line and wait for my retracement and be out at BE or if price bounces around keep picking up my MPTM until price does move. If price goes against me. I will drop my 1st level and try to BE on the rest. Lets say I drop my 1st level at -500. I already profited 262 so my loss on that trade will be 238 but I will be playing to make that up with fresh trades and will wipe that deficit out in 2 or 3 days. So my profit curb will take a dip and then continue upward. This is how my system works and if you can ever get it, (and I know it is difficult to grasp all of this, so if you dont get it, just keep plugging away until you do or go on to another system). But you must understand, in this series of trades, I may not make a profit but I am not going to take a loss either. I will have other trades that will profit and my losers I try to break even. Bottom line in the long run, I make money, my broker makes money, we are both happy.

--- 帖子 #1306 ---
Hi Bob,

Thanks you for detailed explanation.

I think aloud but don’t see it making any sense. The only positive way to view it is that MPTM produced more realised P/L, while leaving even more unrealised P/L as DD for 2.4.2 system to recover.

Take the sample of previous transaction I posted, and assume the new 5th order is in DD and 50pips away from open price of first transaction ,e,g. current price is 87.43=86.93+50. If we don’t do MPTM, the loss is 50 pips.
With this pips, we have 106 pips(87.43-86.37) unrealised P/L DD and 20 pips realised profit, the loss is 86 pips (106-20).

Our bank account has two pockets, left pocket is realised P/L and right pocket unrealised which we are also responsible for.

Open Time                  Close Time         Price Close  Price Item
SELL 2010.04.05 14:41 2010.04.05 17:42 86.93 86.88 audjpyfxf
SELL 2010.04.05 17:422010.04.06 01:5186.8186.56 audjpyfxf
SELL 2010.04.06 01:512010.04.06 04:3086.5086.45 audjpyfxf
SELL 2010.04.06 04:30 2010.04.08 15:27 86.37 86.29 audjpyfxf

Happy trading!

OK my top 11 pairs and alternates:
This gives me 2 of each: aud, cad, chf, gbp, nzd,
4 of each eur, usd, jpy
aud/cad - aud/nzd this matc hes minor or commodity currencies together. As I have stated before minor currencies can get squashed by the larger currencies.
chf/jpy - eur/jpy - eur/usd - eur/cad - eur/nzd
gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy
Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility. __________________
I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.[/quote][/quote]

--- 帖子 #1319 ---
Dont worry you will get some, they are unavoidable no matter what system you trade. What I always try to do is not close out losing trades until I have the profits to close them out. I may close out an individual trade for a loss, around 4-500 pips (this happens 1-3 times a month) but the whole series or multiple level ones I like to have the profits in the bank or on the board first. Takes time to learn that and wait out. Nice run so far today. I have closed about half of my profits and will let the rest run.

--- 帖子 #1327 ---
Your broker is a 5 Digit broker so use the 5 digit EAs. When you trade during the day remember in day trading price usually follows the direction it is going. In other words once price goes north it will stay north for the day. If it is going south it will stay south for the day. Stay out of the middle of the chart and trade the edges. Catch the rebounds on the news the next day and dont try to anticipate a mid day of correction. Here is a pic of one day candles. Notice the bodies are usually full meaning price goes one way and stays one way for the day.

--- 帖子 #1328 ---
The 5D EA entered the trade with USDJPY (5digit) but not CADJPY (4digit). Any advice?

--- 帖子 #1329 ---

--- 帖子 #1335 ---
If you are above the Red lines you are in safer territory. The MA cross serves one major purpose. It increases your odds that when you enter, price is really going to change in that direction. BUT that does not always happen, sometimes it crosses and then continues on its trend and we have a negative trade. Then we get our infamous runner. All currencies during the year will have a run and go off the chart. We do three things to combat that.  We use a MA cross so that we wait  patiently for price direction to change. We wait until price is at an extreme before we try to counter trend the trade. We use the 2.4.2 recovery system to zero out the runner trade and multi level the trade. We had used a 3x3 cross and got into trades earlier but we also got involved in more runners. I think the 6x6 has helped us in getting out of those trades better. Anyway that is why we dont try to get in too early. You are countertrend trading and you must wait for that counter or you will be becoming a great expert in the 2.4.2 recovery system.

--- 帖子 #1343 ---
To hedge with EAs you must have two screens per currency. One screen runs a buy EA and one screen runs a sell EA and each EA must have a different magic number. I had a hedge trading system in Trading the AUD/NZD successfully thread. I stopped using it when IBFX made the spreads so wide it no longer worked well. You can  download the EAs there and adjust them to what you want. I had tried hedging EAs on many different currencies pairs but I never reall could get it to work over a long period of time on any other currency pair. Maybe you have some better ideas than what I had. It was sad because that was the most profitable system I had ever produced though.

--- 帖子 #1359 ---
If You didn't turn it off (use 6x6 blank template) and MA's are still in direction of trade, EA reenters at MPTM BE.

OK my top 11 pairs and alternates:
This gives me 2 of each: aud, cad, chf, gbp, nzd,
4 of each eur, usd, jpy
aud/cad - aud/nzd this matc hes minor or commodity currencies together. As I have stated before minor currencies can get squashed by the larger currencies.
chf/jpy - eur/jpy - eur/usd - eur/cad - eur/nzd
gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy
Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility. __________________
I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.

--- 帖子 #1363 ---
Take it to the bank folds gbp/nzd, gbp/chf enter at the R Line, it doesnt get better or safer than that. For you to get into trouble price has to blow off the screen, a very unlikely event. Not going to say it never happens but is a rare event. So bet the house today.

--- 帖子 #1364 ---
What does that mean "it reenters at MPTM BE"? Thanks!

--- 帖子 #1365 ---
Lets say 6x6 Buy EA enters a buy order. You set MPTM to BE+10 at 20. Price goes up 20 pips and MPTM sets SL at BE+10. Now price returns down and hit SL. If 6x6 EA is still on and MA's didn't cross down, 6x6 Buy EA open immediately another buy order.

--- 帖子 #1366 ---
Thanks for that. But wouldn't be that almost the same as let the initial trade open without paying the additional spread?

--- 帖子 #1367 ---
It was discussed on this thread.

This is Bob's example
http://www.forexfactory.com/showpost...postcount=1298

--- 帖子 #1368 ---
Thanks Patreze!

I just think about it and scratch my head. Because when you set a SL only 10 pips away you often just get stopped out due to the noise. Reentering right at the SL level again doesn't look that sexy to me.  Sorry if I don't get that right yet.

I see you get a lot of those +10 pips BE trades which is great. All those trades mean that the position was in the plus 20 pips at least. As the probability of getting stopped out at BE with a 10 pips stop (initially) you could just set a tp of 20 pips and all those +10 pips BE trades would be immediately +20 pips.

Of course in that case we have the problem that there are trades which don't look back and we need some runners as well. So maybe one could just close one half at +20 and let the remaining half run without that BE stop?

I just think about to optimize this a bit. The system here is one of the most logical and best out there. It will always work because it just simple and rock solid.

--- 帖子 #1369 ---
Well, I say try it, test it and then share it with us

--- 帖子 #1370 ---
Right, finally I got it. The main goal is just to exploit the short term randomness and price fluctuations and collect those 10 pips ever and ever again.

That reminds me on grid trading where you just set a tp of 10 pips and place several pending stop (buy/sell) orders in the direction of the move. Should work the same way as this is almost exactly what happens beside the fact that you use a SL to catch those 10 pips and reenter there where it would be the same to initially use a tp of 10 pips and reenter there. The only difference is the case where the price just go ahead without looking back.

--- 帖子 #1371 ---
There is one more scenario and this is the benefit. If you are in the same 4H candle yes the EA will always reenter. However if you are in a new candle then all the lines have moved and on a retrace you may also get a cross back up and no reentrance. This does not happen often but it can and so you pick a different entrance later. This is when prices are in a very tight range. At first it seems crazy, you just seem to be paying the spread over and over again but total pip wise I pick up a lot more pips this way. Where the benefit comes is over a period of days where price action is going nowhere and you pick up 1 one day. 2 the next, 1 the next and then price takes off somewhere. It was an extra 40 pips I did not pick up before. Lets say price went against you and you have to do a 2nd level and later you zero out or take a small profit/loss trade. That is 40 pips you never would have gotten if you had just played the cross. That 1st level trade got you nothing but a loss on the books and your only profit came from the 2nd level. At least this way you got something from that trade. So lets say the MPTM picked up +40 but later you closed a zero out trade of -100 1st level and +100 2nd level for 0 but with the MPTM that series of trades bagged you an extra 40 which ended up being your profit on a zero out trade sequence. Clear as mud yes??? When you think of trading I think of a trade sequence instead of one single trade win or lose. When I have a DD in a currency pair, I might end up with 8-15 trades before I am done. Maybe 40% are MPTM, 1 or 2 are losing trades and the rest were profitable. So the entire trade sequence is really your profit or loss. That sometimes is the hard part to grasp and understand.

--- 帖子 #1372 ---
For example I was into the AUD/JPY for most of the month on one big long trading sequence. I did 36 closing trades on it. Here is the breakdown: 21 were MPTM for 210 pips  5 were for losses for -484 10 were winners for +357 Without the MPTM my pip profit is smaller than my pip loss. (You must remember my losses are 1st level trades and they have the lowest lot size, so moneywise I make money even though I have lost more pips than won.) So with out the MPTM I am -127 pip wise (money wise there was a small profit) But with the MPTM I am +83 pip wise and sitting on a much bigger profit. Anyway that is my breakdown on that trade sequence.

--- 帖子 #1379 ---
If I were trading this chart manually, I wouldn't have entered yet. I'd wait for Red,White and Blue to be at extremes with price in  bottom 1/3 ,1/4 of chart and then confirmed divergence. That is, you get a lower low with the next 4HR candle closing higher. I also have a couple other rules I follow when it comes to divergence. The divergence has to be spread over at least 4 candles but no more than 5 days. The confirmation candle has to be green for a buy and not a pin bar or spinning top with a tail pointing up. On the chart below, if that last green candle finishes green and doesn't finish with a tail up, I'm in at close. Why the two RSI indicators? One is a high and one is a low. Look at the low when your getting lower lows and the high for higher highs.

--- 帖子 #1382 ---
I took three aud pairs. It depends on if the currencies are related. For instance the gbp, euro, and chf are all similar but the aud/nzd is not. Aud/cad is good buy since it dropped off of a nonevent. The Cad did not raise its rates so the news made it move crazy. However, not raising rates makes a good rebound trade the next day or two later. Aud/chf Makes a great sell because Euro currencies are all showing weakness across the board. Aud/nzd is a great buy and the NZD is not related to any thing happening in Europe. So I have sells on aud/chf, and buys on aud/cad and aud/nzd.

Hi Bob,

About MPTM, I've playing around with this EA and the thousands of possiblities/options. As you've tested it for quite a long time now, what do you reckon are the best settings so far, and also, the settings to apply so that the EA doesn't interfeer with other open trades and stuff...?

--- 帖子 #1401 ---
I only use two settings Breakeven with a +10 profit after 20 pips and Jump Stop. It moves the stop loss every 25 pips. The rest of the EA I dont find that useful at least not at this point. You can change the settings in the EA to work with any currency pair only or any magic number etc. You will have to set them yourself. I am happy with the BE part and that is all I plan on using.

When you are learning a system you should not be trading the high volatile pairs. Unless you are ready for 5-800 DD you shouldnt touch EUR/NZD or GBP/NZD, along with the gbp/jpy. I make a lot of money on the eur/nzd but I also have traded it for a couple of years. It is a nasty pair that can move 4-800 pips in one day. The GBP/NZD I actually use 250-300 pip reentries. So Downsize that puppy and leave it alone. It is not worth trading live unless you really know what you are doing.

BreakEvenPips = 20

BreakEvenProfit =10

JumpingStopPips =25

Let me know if that's wrong, thanks again

--- 帖子 #1416 ---
That is what I have been using. For example. I took a loss on the L2 Eur/nzd but my MPTM has regained 75% of that loss already. Now if I get my retrace or BE on that pair I am  out with very little damage. For most traders that trade would be a disaster but with my system and a little patience and smart trading you get out with just a little worry for a time.

--- 帖子 #1418 ---
I'm liking this system quite a bit, and trading it on a micro account.  I just downloaded the new 6x6 indicators on the v4 system.  However, I can't trade EA's with my broker, so am trading this manually.  Not really a problem.

I'm seeing a good trade on NZD/JPY, so will be entering that as soon as I get home.  That's one nice thing about EA's, they can place trades while you are away at work!  But this being a 4H time frame, unless the pair really takes off, it is safe to assume the trade will still be valid after another bar.

One thing I'm not very clear on, is what initial stop losses NB is using.  One thing that should would work well is to use the distance between the Yellow and Blue sixth indicator, and then put your SL that far away from initial entry.  I assume the EA's already set a S/L, but I'll be putting these in manually as I said before.

I believe that as long as we manage the "runners" (those pairs that zoom in one direction without retracing) this system is quite robust.  Esp. for pairs which are known for rangy behavior.

OK my top 11 pairs and alternates:
This gives me 2 of each: aud, cad, chf, gbp, nzd,
4 of each eur, usd, jpy

gbp/jpy - gbp/usd - usd/chf - usd/jpy
Alternatives: the aud/jpy, eur/jpy, are all similiar so choose one. The Aud/jpy is not as volatile as the gbp/jpy if you want less movement but still like some volatility but it will do long trends more. The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

Most volatile pairs: eur/nzd and gbp/jpy can be replaced with aud/jpy nzd/jpy nzd/chf for less volatility. __________________
I no longer trade usd/sgd. It is going to 25:1 leverage, simply not worth using up that much margin for a slow mover like that.

--- 帖子 #1423 ---
IF YOU HAVE THE MPTM SET FOR 'TRUE' for manage all trades, it will manage all your trades. If you have manual trades it does them all. If you close one trade with a magic number, the EA closes all trades of the same magic number on that currency pair not the MPTM. If you have 4 trades going and each one has a different magic number or are manual the MPTM handles each trade seperately. Only when you have two trades using the same magic number will it close both. The MPTM does not close both trades but the EA does. That is why with Ver. 4 I have seperate EA with seperate magic numbers for each level. You handle each level seperately with the MPTM. That is why yesterday I closed that one EUR/NZD 2L without affecting the other levels. It is also why I am not getting my good separation on my levels because I am entering off of crosses and S/R lines instead of every 200 pips like in the past. We will see if this is a good thing or not. But I will take those trade off of S/R lines above the gold lines. Those are pretty safe trades.

--- 帖子 #1424 ---
Update:

Maybe a partial answer from myself... MPTM just tried to open a long trade upon an MA cross.

THE MPTM DOES NOT OPEN TRADES, IT ONLY  MANAGES EXISTING TRADES. IT IS A SEPARATE EA FROM THE OTHERS THAT ONLY MANAGES EXISTING TRADES.

--- 帖子 #1425 ---
I will trade 3L on any pair. Some are entered with the EA, some are entered manually. The MPTM never enters trades, it only manages existing trades. It is the one that moves up the SL to BE and +10. That is all it does.

--- 帖子 #1441 ---
That is why that pair is on the most volatile list. If you are going to play with the gbp/nzd be ready to use 250-300 reentries. For this pair your situation is normal. You are not used to this so you have a choice. Close out and never use it again or learn to deal with this situation. GBP/NZD, GBP/anything will do this. EUR/NZD EUR/JPY same thing to a lesser degree. Remember my aud/jpy trade, I took 3 weeks to zero it out in fact I made a profit with it. I have played the gbp/nzd at times and gone 3 levels -150 or about 700 in the hole for L1 and ended up with a profit so. Count this as part of your learning tuition. There is a reason why I dont even list that pair, I only trade it when it is at very high/low extremes.

The reason I teach multi-level trading is this will not be the first or last time you will find yourself in this situation. I have a plan. If I go 2-300 pips in the hole I reenter again. If I retrace to profit great. If not I will reenter again. The first time you this it scares the ............... out of you but once you get used to using it. Heck I find it normal. Yesterday I was over -2000 pips DD. Today I am -1600 pips DD but I pocketed another 1000+ in the bank. If you can master this and it will take time and you will take your lumps. You will find forex trading not stressful.

I use the high/low EA or I manually input them at just below or above S/R lines. But you could use it. In my trading arsenal and I dont want to confuse the H........... out of you guys but I use a BB sometimes, 6x6, 3x3, 1x7, depending on how I am reading the charts. Once you get used to 6x6 you will look at a trade and say, I wish I could get in quicker now than the 6x6 so I use different EAs or if this moves up a couple more pips what a great entrance for the high/low EA. It will all come over time. I only tell you about my 6x6 trades and enters above and below the gold line.

Anyways I am taking that trade. Below Gold, RWB below 15, double bottom, looks good to me. I entered manually right at support and put the 3x3 EA on there. If it moves up strongly I can be in again.

--- 帖子 #1449 ---
Just to let you know I try to keep my ratios low so I can handle surprises without damaging my account. I trade nickels at 800 dollars this month and my return on one live account (4H system) has been 25%, one of my best months ever. I have used this EA for 2 weeks at .05 and one week at .01 and my return has been 10.3%. These numbers would keep your account with less than 10% on average DD and 20% when I was running my worst case DD. To hit 83% or triple of what I have done would mean in a worst case DD you would be endangering your account. Now if you have extra money to put in the account you can trade like that but if you dont then it is dangerous. I now have a rule that if my margin goes bigger than 20% of my account on a DD I will add more funds to that account and keep my ratios intact. That way I can run my 2.4.2 recovery system without being hampered by not having enough funds. So those are my rules guys in case you need to know. Those rules come from a lot of bad experiences but those numbers seem to fit if you trade at a 100:1 leverage. I hope this helps some of you with your trading.

I just helped out a guy who had a very large account and was over 10% DD on just a few trades. I used about 20% sized lots than he used and I got him back to BE after a couple of days. So keep your account intact and trade wisely. Again nothing wrong with 83% return is you have the extra funds to put in the account quickly if it gets into trouble. But if you dont have a buffer then you will get into trouble at some point. I have 3 accoutns with IBFX. I trade 2 live and one has reserve money just in case. IBFX will transfer from one account to another in a matter of minutes if I need it. So that is how I trade and how I protect myself.

--- 帖子 #1457 ---
No it means I closed the trade for +100 profit. The only thing the MTPM does is bring my SL up to break even +10. That is why I report them separately. So I might have 4 closes on a pair 2 were +10 MPTM L1 maybe small loss and a L2 profit. I just count up the MPTM I dont have time to write about each one. In fact some morinngs I spend 45 minutes trying to prepare my report. I dont know how much longer I can keep doing this. It is time consuming but also very essential that new traders see the real life of trading. The real ups and downs. You need to see the DD and the losing trades and not just talk about the winners. A lot of so called trainers of Forex in real life are really not good live traders. They only talk about after the fact. I think it is better you see I will enter this trade today and you see what it is really like. I do have losing trades and I really do get into trouble. That is the real reality of trading. Not everything goes as planned.

--- 帖子 #1461 ---
MPTM 6 DIGITS SOLUTION:

Ok, finally found out a solution.

Take the "MPTM BREAKEVEN EA", and change breakeven to 200 (instead of 20) and break evn profit to 100 (instead of 10). If you want to use a jump of 30 pips, change it to 300. Also, change manage this pair only to "true" and manage all pairs to "false". Save this new EA to "MPTM BREAKEVEN EA 6 DIGITS"

How to use it? open a trade manually or with 6X6 EA, and drag and drop your 6D MPTM EA to manage your trade.

At last...
