--- 帖子 #1467 ---
Kraven,

As you are new to Forex and MT4, I would advise you demo just using manual trades first.  Even if you use NB's system, you can trade it manually.  EA's are fine once you understand what you want them to do, but they can be confusing if you don't know why they are opening trades.  Better that you know why you opened a trade yourself, so that you can study it and learn how to close it out properly.

Also, before anyone else says it, you should head over to babypips.com and take their entire course, you will learn about how much you do and don't know.

One other thing to be aware of, at least it bothers me.... MT4 allows your broker to see EVERYTHING you are doing, including all stop losses and take profits on every trade.  This means they hold all the cards.  There are some EAs, such as the MPTM that is used here, that will manage your trade and hide this info from the broker (at least we hope it does).

Anyway, welcome to the craziness that is Forex.  Best damned market in the world, IMO.

--- 帖子 #1470 ---
First your spacing is good. Your at support that it good. Every NZD currency is at a decision point. I have about the same thing except I am only two levels deep. I didnt get that firstlevel. If price went below that support you would close level 1 and take it as a loss. then find a new 3rd level. L 3 now becomes tricky. If it is making a nice profit I take that profit because price will oftne go back to the support level several times sometimes and I want that  profit every time. This is where I get a lot of my MPTM. So anytime I am sitting on 100 pip profit I take it. The slower currencies 50. Anyway the GBP/NZD has bounced off S line now 4 times. I havent done as well with this one as I have with others but I have gotten 4 MPTM and one profit of 50 playing off that bottom. When price is changing direction it can sit at a bottom or top for several days before really reversing and you can pick up most of your DD there. I did that with the AUD/JPY at the beginning of the month and acutally covered almost all my DD from those bounces. So when  price finally moved down on that pair and I zeroed out the trade I actually turned a profit. So play those bounces off of the S line and see how many times you can pick up some pips. Once you get the hang of it you really relax as a trader. These things happen all the time and you begin to see them coming. You just dont know when and where but they do come.  For me on this trade, I already have broken even and if price now moves up, I will make a profit in this series of trades. I dont look at trading anymore one trade at a time, I now trade the series of trades and try to come out on top.

--- 帖子 #1478 ---
Well thanks for this great "bouncing L3 MTPM" lesson Bob! I'm sure it'll help many people recovering through 2.4.2 system.

For the GBP/NZD, L1 was 6x6 EA, L2 and L3 were manual. If I want to play with the boucing L3 MPTM, how can I make sure it won't close all my trades, but only my L3 level, when it it's the MPTM S/L?

--- 帖子 #1479 ---
Because none have the same magic number. That is why an EA has a magic numer so you can deal with more than one trade at a time. Since manual trades dont have one and EA only entered one L the MPTM will handle them all separately. I went through the MTPM code today and noticed it will set TP for you too. So you can use it for that too. The MPTM doesnt close all levels the EA does. If the EA has put multiple levels with the same magic number and the MPTM closes one, its the EA that closes the rest. The EA only closes the trades it entered with the same magic number. Any trade without that magic number will not be controled by that EA. So you can put manual trades on but without the magic number the EA willnot control them. The MPTM will manage all the trades but only one at a time. If it closes one it is the only trade it closes. If it is one that the EA is controling then the EA will close all the other trades with the same magic number and nothing more. So if MPTM closes a trade that is the only one it touches. The EA only handles trades it enters and attaches its magic number too. Manual trades dont have the magic number so the EA does not handle them. The MPTM will close manual trades, EA trades but on a case by case basis. Hope this clears it all up.

--- 帖子 #1496 ---
Hi Nanningbob!

Thank you greatly for posting all your hard work and congratulations on the great result for April.

I downloaded version 4 today and noticed a problem in the CloseAll script, just because I encountered the same thing today in the EA I am writing. (Which is not ready for the world yet!)

Any of the cases in CloseAll that may skip order(s) i.e. cases 1 to 7, will not work properly if any orders are actually skipped. The reason being that after the skip, OrderSelect(0,SELECT_BY_POS,MODE_TRADES); would keep getting the same order again until cnt equals total and so not close any following orders that might need to be closed.

The way I fixed it in my code was:

change

OrderSelect(0,SELECT_BY_POS,MODE_TRADES);

to

OrderSelect(cnt,SELECT_BY_POS,MODE_TRADES);

i.e. replace 0 by cnt

and add

cnt--;

total--;

into the section of the code which runs when an order is deleted.

--

This is my first post at FF so if I have done something wrong by posting a code fix here then please excuse me. If I come across anything else, should I post here or email you?

Again, many thanks.

David

PS: The Nanning park topiary shown on your site is stunning.

--- 帖子 #1509 ---
LOL there was a time I didnt know that either. You are looking for that in your computer. Go to C: , then program files, then IBFX, then profiles and put the profiles there. This new system I didnt post a profile you must do that yourself. Choose what currencies you want to trade, set up your screens then save your profile.

On MT4 go to file in the upper left hand corner, then profiles, give a name and save it. I also save my setting under default so I save it under two names. SOmetimes when an update comes down it messes up my profiles, so the one I use the most is named and also is set up as my default.

--- 帖子 #1522 ---
One thing I try to discipline myself to do is to not enter during the day. Once a currency goes in a direction it will often stay in that direction, so 80% of my decisions are made before the JPY session. You will find price at a S/R level here more than any other time. I have found that entering during the day will most likely just get you more backed up. Except for gbp/nzd and eur/nzd the NZD is not a volatile pair and will almost always stay within a 4-600 pip range. I find them safe to trade for most of the year.

--- 帖子 #1524 ---
You are trading too large of lots. Even at 3000 pips in the hole my DD seldom goes over 20% of my account.  Lesson #1 in trading, dont overleverage, will get you into trouble no matter what system you use. Lesson #2 When learning a new system never start with the volatile pairs. Lesson #3 Learn to take a loss. If my account gets near the 20% level of my account I am closing L1 trades or adding more funds to my account if I think the trades are still good. IF YOU CANT CLOSE A LOSING TRADE, YOU NEED TO GET OUT OF THE BUSINESS. YOU WILL HAVE LOSING TRADES.  I have a plan and I stick to that plan. Somewhere at - 400 -500 I am taking my L1 loss. I violated it on my last eur/nzd and took a bigger loss than I should have but I still closed it.
You cant be a good trader until you are willing to handle that bad trade and take the loss.
Being 50% down is not the trading systems loss. You violate the rules you gonna get burned in this business.

--- 帖子 #1526 ---
My experience in news trading is if a currency is way overbought/oversold the market is predicting the direction of the news. Buy the rumor, sell the news. The combo of the Euro news and Aud interest rate has driven the NZD to way overbought and I suspect an abandonment at the news story. The AUD pairs are giving a mixed signal so I will go in with lower lot sizes. I go in with 2/3 or 1/2 of my normal lot size and that has served me well. That way if I am surprised I still can trade my way out of trouble. If you are a conservative trader follow Toothman. He is a very solid trader. Me I am riskier, sometimes I think I should let him do all the teaching but then you would never learn the 2.4.2 system.

IMF debt should be senior and no bank should be allowed to roll over debt and reduce their exposure to Greek debt on the back of foreign tax-payers.

--- 帖子 #1531 ---
In American money that is 5 cents not 50 cents. 50 cents would be way too much. So if I get 100 pips I make 5 dollars. 4000 pips about 200 dollars. My goal is to be around 8-12% increase of my account every month. Last month I did better than 20% but that was a very unusual month. I dont expect that to happen often. I take trading as an investment not a get rich or make a living thing. So that is my approach. Obviously 10% return on my investment every month is very much worth my time. As my account gets bigger I will lower my expectations to 5%. This way I dont ever blow an account and I trade very reasonably. It  took me almost 3 years to learn this and it is very hard to get traders to understand and comprehend these numbers. They want to put my EA on the back tester and see if it makes them a million bucks in 6 months. Just not going to happen. Being 50% down should never happen. Lots are way to big or you are way underfunded. Again when I  post my DD at 3000 pips I am still under 20% of my account. I feel if you trade bigger than that you are really asking for trouble. I hope that is understandable.

--- 帖子 #1546 ---
FOR ALL THE PEOPLE WHO ARE UNSURE of lot sizing with this system. As a general rule NORMALLY you should use 1/50000 to determine your lot size (e.g. if you have $1000 divide by 50000 you get 0.02 as lot size). This is for lower time frames with Stop loss of around 25 pips.

HOWEVER, and this is very important, with higher Time Frames such as daily and 4 hour this should be 1/500,000 to 1/200,000. For instance BOB is using $1,000 divided by 200,000 = 0.005, which is 5 cents a pip. Unless you are willing and able to top up your account anything more is pointless.

If you read BOB`s instruction book regarding 2-4-2 recovery you can see that you may need around 1200 pips for one trade, now imagine there are 3 trades at the same time. That is 3600 pips down plus you have to have a balance to cover your margin. The maths does not add up. As BOB says this is not a get rich quick but a slow and steady system.

Good LUCK

Ok, I read through the 'right manual' and the system sounds like a good fit for me considering the hours!  I trade futures during 9am to 11am EST, so I want to be available and focused on that as it is my bread and butter.

So if I understand right:

1.  Download the zip file, do the usual indicator ea positioning and chart opening.  Charts open 4H using the blank template.  I am using fxopen ECN and they don't have all the same currencies, but close enough.  In addition, open a chart using the 6X6 BE template set up for EUR/GBP or any other one you are not using to place trades.

2.  Then, go through the blank template and save a copy of each template w/ a separate EA for 1st Entry, 2nd Entry, 3rd Entry and save each separate template.  This is so MPTM (stop ea) can manage them separately.  (Set up EA to accommodate my taste-buds).  Verify MPTM is loaded onto each chart.

3.  When loading EA's, verified live trading and also in options, live trading is enabled.   Face is smiling on top right corner.

3.  Review your charts for a Primary or Secondary entry and when one occurs, I switch my template from 'blank' which has no EA's to the 1st Entry EA of either Buy or short.

4.  If trade goes against you, follow 2.4.2 recovery plan or whatever you feel is appropriate.  Personally I have been a cut the losers approach, but interested in this to see what BE can do for me.

5.  If Trade is for you, MPTM will jump or go to be+10 automatically if you have it open on any chart.

--- 帖子 #1556 ---
The MPTM will only need to be on one chart for it will manage all trades from one chart. I use the eur/chf since I dont trade it. You can change the settings for the MPTM to handle one currency at a time but it is set to handle all trades from only one chart. Forex trading is around 70-80% bouncing between two points which my system is dynamite. 20%-30% taking Break even trades and 5-10% trying to survive the runners.

--- 帖子 #1565 ---
Why do I trade a 4H chart. It is because it tells a story. Here is the story it is telling about the usd/chf. If you notice in the last 8 weeks. The usd/chf goes to its high or low aound wed or thurs and then retraces. It has done this 8 of the last 8 weeks. Now is it guaranteed to do that this week again? No, of course not but that is how I will play it. The odds are in my favor. One nice retrace and I end up with a profitable trade. And we all are happy. If not I have a back up plan. That is how I trade and try to teach. Look at this pic. the dotted lines divide the chart by weeks, the solid lines show the turnaround spot every week. I will play this consistancy. The 4H chart speaks and tells a story, learn to read the story it is telling you.

--- 帖子 #1566 ---
hi I encountered the same when I first loading the "6x6 BE Jump" template.

This what I did:

For MPTM overwriting with NB-iBreakeven issue:

- Right click & select "Indicators List" or Control+I ;

- Double click on NB i-Breakeven and set the "Corner" to "1"

- Press ok and done, the breakeven info will appear in Top Right Hand Corner

Note: Corner 2 = Bottom left

Corner 3 = Bottom right

For NB-iExporure showing "unknown" trades:

- Right click & select "Indicators List" or Control+I;

- Double click on the NB iExposure, don't change anything and click "OK" to close it;

- Done and now it shd show only your trades

Hope it helps

--- 帖子 #1610 ---
Hello Nanningbob.

I really enjoyed reading your thread during the last days.

Your work and the documentation on the system is great.

But let me ask you one question:

Why would you rather hedge a position instead of just closing an order?

If you hedge on the same pair (which I assume this is what you're talking about) you just open a trade against your initial trade.

As an example: If you first did buy 1 lot and the hedge the position with selling a lot, on the bottom line you do nothing - the same as just closing the positions and wait for a chance to reenter.

Also a disadvantage is the spread you need to pay again and maybe interest rates.

I would like to hear your point. Am I missing something?

Greetings.

MikeFT

--- 帖子 #1611 ---
A hedge is an emergency stop trading. In other words you are caught in a super news story and everything is going against you. You are looking at a large loss and you know it is going to get worse. You have two choices, take a loss that may take you weeks to recover from or you can freeze time where you dont make money and you dont lose money. The news story plays out and then you can go back to regular trading and reduce your debt.

Lets say your DD is at -2000 and a super news story hits that could send you to -5000. Instead of taking a -2000 SL you freeze time with a hedge or you can try to ride out a -5000 DD. With a hedge, two days later you close out your proft trades and subtract the same amount from your DD. then deal with your -2000 DD from a couple of days ago. In other words you only trade the market when it suits you not the other way around. It gets you past the bad trades that are really going bad. You keep the trades that are going good. You caught the wave of the news story and hedge the ones going bad. That is the value of hedging. You trade the market only when it is ranging the way you like.

A managed account I am doing was at -1274 DD on all the trades. I knew news was going to make the market go nuts. So I hedged all the trades. The market could have sent the DD into thousands in the hole but during that whole mess the DD never moved. Now I have -1274 DD which consists of -1704 in losses and +430 in profit. I will look at the trades Monday, the news Monday and see if I want to start trading again or sit on these hedges. I can now wait this entire news story thing out. The guys here know I can handle a -1274 DD pretty easy. I had one inverstor write me and tell me, hey you avoided the blood bath. I know one guy who tried to trade these moves and lost over a 1000 dollars in less than an hour. He was trading fifty cent lots. That is the value of hedging, you make everything equal, walk away and while everyone else is having a heart attack, my blood pressue didnt rise 1 point. I will read the news over the weekend, wait for the monday gaps and then decide whether the market has settled enough for me to trade. If it isnt and the market is going to go nuts again next week. I will sit on my hedges while everyone else is pulling their hair out. At some point the market will return to normal. I will take a couple of trades above below the gold lines and my DD will be gone.  That my friend is the value of hedging.

--- 帖子 #1612 ---

Again when you are having super news stories like now indicators are worthless, the market is moving too fast for them to tell you it story.

Look at the pic below, the gbp/usd moved around a 1000 pips last week. No indicator told you it was going to do that, no indicator can tell you how far down or how far up it is going to go now. We are way out of normal range. The Brits are having an election in which no one is winning, the pound is in deep DooDoo with debt. You dont know if some bank or company will all of a sudden buy a bunch or GBP to give the currency support or sell off and send it another 1000 pips down. bets in favor of the U.S. dollar to the highest since the

launch of the euro in 1999, a currency strategist said on

Friday, citing data from the Commodity Futures Trading

of $16.24 billion the previous week, according to CFTC and

Reuters data.

If I had played the 6x6 cross I would not have been in many of these trades but I was taking entrances off of S/R lines which is ok except in super news stories. So I lost almost all my April profit. I will not be trading Monday and I make no recommendations. I will start Tuesday if I see some stability and the Greek loan thing is going OK. If you trade the EURO or GBP I would only do sells if you have a good reason too. Buys are way to risky in this market.

The following currencies seem to be the least affected by the news:

aud/cad, aud/chf, eur/aud, eur/cad, eur/gbp, nzd/usd usd/jpy

I do not recommend trading any euro or gbp because of news and elections. ENGLAND's elections are up for grabs and uncertain so the GBP could do anything unexpected and the euro is well down the tubes for now.

So look only at these for now:

aud/cad, aud/chf, nzd/usd usd/jpy

Funny how in OCT. 2008 the worse the news was the more the USD appreciated and May 2010 the worse the news for the EURO the more it depreciates. Love them fundamentals and their consistency.

My goal is to get back what I have lost and it will probably take 2 months. If I could have hedged all this I would have been frozen in at around a -3000 DD and that would have been recoverable. I will be leaving IBFX but I am not sure where yet. I never want to be caught with my pants down again where my only option is taking a big loss. I believe I could have fought my way out of this at a future date if I could have hedged this mess at some point.

The most important thing is you dont want to be heavily investment into any one currency. If the EUR/NZD is too volatile for your tastes you can replace it with nzd/chf or nzd/jpy. I just happen to like the eur/nzd pair and the way it flies around the chart.

--- 帖子 #1632 ---
ECN brokers still use MT4 and can do all the same shenanigins as any other MT4 broker. Nice advertising gimmick though. The back room, front room, no room doesnt change the software that is used to run the programs. Those can be set into the programming but still be announced that there is no dealing desk. Since you never get to see the prgramming you dont know what they are really doing. I noticed the difference in spreads between IBFX and FX Sol but there is also a price difference in what they are quoting as the now price. You can  show that there is a lower spread price but all they have to do is adjust the quoted price to make up the difference. You are going to pay the spread no matter what broker you have. Again it is all an advertising gimmick. You do your buy/sell and price moves a couple of pips and then you get the trade or they have a buffer between what they quote you and the real price but you dont know what that is. That can all be put into the programming software and you think you are getting a better deal.

Why do you think everytime you enter a trade the first thing that happens is price sits for a bit during a strong move or it backs up against you a couple of pips right away. Once you make your trade they then can put your trade to the actual price and let it run only takes a split second. Used to wonder why every trade always went against me the first couple of seconds or for some reason my trade would pause before moving with a strong trend. It is all in the programming.

--- 帖子 #1639 ---
There are TWO groups of people trading Forex. First group`s goal is to make money and avoid losses regardless of how many or few trades they engage in during x period of time. The second group`s goal is to be trading constantly and hoping to make money. It is for each individual to decide to which group they belong to.

--- 帖子 #1645 ---
Yes that is the stop loss setting. I use the MPTM to bring it up once the trade gets going. My  profit is pips times whatever lots I am trading. I measure profit not in dollars but percentage of account. This helps those who trade small amounts. With 100:1 leverage you need to trade 1000 dollars to trade .03-.05 lots. that is 3 pennies to 5 pennies a lot. I average 10-20% a month. So far I have had 2 losing months since aug. 2009 December and probably this month. I am in the process of changing brokers and hope to have my new accont funded by the middle of the week. I am testing all my EAs on the new broker demo now to make sure everything is OK before I finish funding the account.

--- 帖子 #1646 ---
I dont know if anyone is making a living trading. Trading is more of investment to me. If you try to make a living you get into a concept of I have to make xx dollars a week or month and you put this artificial  pressure on your self to always increase your account. That is simply not reasonable. No system wins every month but you want a system that is consistent over a period of time. Second if your not making your amount you want to make everyweek you have a tendency not to close a losing trade scenario. During this news market I stop trading because I want to keep my investment. I dont need to keep trying to trade to make an income. So  my attitude is different. I dont need to trade this month if I dont like the market moves I can sit out and wait for the market to be more favorable. If you want an income you are desperately looking for something that will make money so you can keep trading. That is the  difference. If you are looking for a steady income I dont think trading Forex is a good ticket. If you are looking for investment returns and are patient to wait out the bad times Forex can bring you better returns than other investments. To me that is the difference and how I think. During a years time the market will range 70-75% of the time, perfect for my trading systems. 20% of the time it is trending and I try to survive those runs, which I usually do. Then there are times 5-10% when the market is driven  by news, like now, and my system is not good during those times, in fact no system is. If you dont know how to trade the news you will get killed during these periods. I admit I am not a good news trader so I have found out the hard way to just sit and wait these periods out.  If you trade for investment taking a month or a couple of weeks off, like I did last December is not a problem. If you want a steady income you feel this false pressure to trade and get killed during these times. Unless you are a good news trader you are looking for trouble to trade during these weeks dominated by Euro bad news. So to me the  best way to trade right now is to sit on your hands or hedge your trades until the market settles back down again.

--- 帖子 #1649 ---
I am trying to unhedge them now. Using a sell on the chf/usd and buy on gbp/usd. Because the one side of the hedge has made a profit I can now come back the other way and try to reduce the debt to the profit made or get as close as I can. If it works as planned my loss will be much less than just taking a loss. Basically you hedge until you get a MA cross on a 1H or 4H chart to go back the other way. When the cross happens it is just like normal trading using my system. I add a level and away we go.

--- 帖子 #1657 ---
Dear Bob

If anyone had any doubts about your trading system / philosophy the events of the last two weeks should have settled their doubts once and for all. The system was put to the test and it passed with flying colours. Movements of 300, 400 or even 600 pips were in abundance. Many of us were facing large DDs and were quite anxious. Some people cut their losses, some stuck to the system religiously and rode the storm, and some people did half and half. Needless to say the second group were the winners. I belong to the last group and with hindsight wished that I had kept my nerves.

The lesson I learned from the whole saga was to realize the weak link in my trading is not the system, indicators, brokers, etc. The problem lies with discipline and psychology of trading and controlling my emotions. All of these with a $1k account and $250 DD. I dread to think of what would have been my trading behaviour if it was a $10 account and DD of $2.5K or even worse $100K account with $25K DD. I do not think my case is unique in FF. Reading people’s writings here in FF I gather most people are very much like me (i.e. mid income, full time job, Mortgage, pension, investments, family commitments, etc), trading small amounts we can lose and hoping to master forex with a view of investing more substantial sums when we are confident of success.

Whilst we are concentrating on technical aspects we are neglecting the most important aspects of trading psychology. The title of this post is "Top 4 things successful traders do" which is an article in investopedia and can be found here ( http://www.investopedia.com/articles...tner=fxweekly5). Please read it and follow the links also. I found it quite helpful, hope you do to.

Bob as our guru and an experienced trader your guidance is very much valued. I would be grateful if you could give us your input. Another topic which we need your help is the use of hedge in situations we experienced couple of weeks ago. I would be grateful if when the opportunity arises you show us an example of how this recovery is done. My apologies for such a long and boring post.

Kind Regards

--- 帖子 #1658 ---
Good article, solid read. It is organized and spelled out some solid thoughts.

--- 帖子 #1659 ---
I think I know what is going on here. When you change the lots you must go into the code and make the changes. Then compile the change. Then drag the new saved EA on the screen and save the template. Then set up all the currencies you want to do and save the profile. I have found out the hard way that MT4 goes to the last saved screen if something goes wrong or even when you just close it out and reverts back to the .07 lots size. If you dont change the template the template has the old saved version at .07 and that needs to change too. Then if your MT4 crashes or your computer crashes MT4 will go back to your last saved default. I got hit with some losses last year when I had to restart my computer and the EA started trading from some older version I used to use. So if you ever change your EA change your template and if you make major revisions safe your profile and resave the default. I once had an update crash my MT4 and it reverted to the default profile and I had a whole different EA system there. Screwed everything up. So now what ever I am trading I am trading off of the default profile setting and I have not had any problems like this since.

--- 帖子 #1660 ---
I am going to have to come up with some unhedging rules. I tried to unhedge the trades Friday and ended up making the problem worse. I finally just closed and took my losses. Clearly you cannot unhedge until the market turns back to normal and proves it has. I thought I had the gbp/usd and usd/chf topped and bottomed out and it ran Friday night and Sunday night. This caused me to just close out and take the loss rather than risk wiping out an account. Of course then the market reversed but I couldnt risk it at that point. So you have to wait for the cross to enter the countertrade and close out the profitable hedge. So I definitley have one rule. You have to wait until the full news run is over. Trying to unhedge before that can lead to disaster. I wish now I had sat on the hedge for another week or two. Bad decision on my part and took some losses I really didnt need to take if I was willing to wait another week or so. I am still not sure if the gbp and chf are done with their runs yet. I will be very happy when this Euro thing is done but it may last all summer and into the fall. If it continues I am going to go to a very small set of currencies that arent strongly affected by Euro news and stay with them for the summer.

--- 帖子 #1661 ---
Here is the dilemma I see. We have a good system that works over a long period of time. It has one weaikness the super news story. Now in Oct. 2008 we had two big news stories and then the markets went back to sorta normal. The two stories was the trillion dollar bailout and the interest rate change which was a biggie. Ok you could see them coming.

This is different.  Greece is going bankrupt. Bailout, no bailout, bailout, some countries threaten to pull out of the Euro, some other countries may face bankruptcy, maybe they need a bailout too, one country wants to do this, another that, .................... and so on. The problem I am seeing is a big super story can come from several different directions at any given time. One thing I read on the news which I did not know until days later but affected the markets greatly when it happened was this. The minister from France at the meeting threatened to pull out of the Euro if all the countries did not get on board of this package. Well, of course that would send the market into a tizzy. The problem is I didnt get to read about that until several days later and then I am already in the hole. That leads me to the next problem, it can happen again at any time in this atmosphere or it may not happen at all. I want you guys to know at this time I dont know if trading is really a good idea other than using MA crosses and going with the flow and forget all the rest of the other indicators. There are just some news stories we are not going to get until its too late. This is not like OCT. 2008 where you knew a big story was coming, it may hit without warning. Dang I loved April and hate May.

--- 帖子 #1662 ---
Thank God we do not have those sort of stories every month, otherwise we all be in trouble. Lets not forget that it was not just this system that was in trouble, every system was. I think the only way we can deal with it is to have some sort of money management rules in place to limit losses during such times. That way we can limit the damage and recover within a given time period (one or two months for instance).

Kind Regards

Go to the 6ths indicator and in the upper corner it gives you the distance from top to bottom of the screen. Using the 4H chart those that are under 800 or better yet those under 600 were the least affected. Those over 800 were. Many currencies are 1000-1400 so that is the best read. I would feel very comfortable trading those under 800 because I know my 2.4.2 system would work if they did make a run and if new news came out I would safely assume they would not be affected again. I posted this on the other thread about a week ago.

OK now here is my recommendations for trading pairs for now. If you look in the top left corner of the sixths EA, it will give you the distance from top to bottom. You can check to see which pairs are going wild and which ones are still tradeable. From this info I would choose the following to trade this week.

I choose these because you could stay within range reentering every 200 pips.

Under 800

usd/jpy, eur/aud, aud/usd,

under 600

nzd/usd, nzd/chf, eur/gbp, aud/chf, aud/cad

just over 800

aud/nzd, eur/cad, nzd/jpy, usd/chf

The under 800 would give you

aud, 4

cad 1

chf 2

euro 2

jpy, 1

gbp 1

nzd 2

usd 3

That would give you 8 pairs. I think that is too heavy with AUD so I would dump the aud/eur (dont trust the euro right now and would add the usd/chf or eur/cad. Until the market settles that would give you 8 safe pairs to trade in these crazy markets. Anyways that should do it.

if the white/blue/red is  below 15 , and the price is below the bottom gold/yellow line on the 6by6, which EA should i run/enable ?

--- 帖子 #1679 ---
Buy on the bottom and sell on the top. If price goes against you around 200 pips you can set up a second position by using the 2ndL and countertrade the first Level. You can also use a third level 200 pips later again. I used to automatically reenter at -200 but now I reenter at a retracement around -200. ML is  main level, 2ndL is second level, 3rdL is 3rd level. I do not recommend going more than 3 levels on a trade because then you are getting into martingaling and you can wipe out your account at some point. 3 levels deep is all I ever go. See info on the 2.4.2 recovery.

Hi Bob,

I noticed that when a trade turns bad, it's often due to the 6x6 entering too late, when momentum is already at the end. What I mean is that the EA often enters on a wick and then, mptm doesn't have enough space (about 25pips) to secure our trade.

So I wanted to suggest a modification on the EA: after a 6x6 cross, wait until the NEXT bar opens, and enter a trade only if the 6 ma's are STILL crossed.

What do you think? Is that possible?

I'm sure this would save us a lot of false signals and make more pips per trade!

Thanks.

and may the seafood platter give you luck!

It does not matter which MA cross you use or open or close candles etc. You will always have some trades that back up on you after you enter. Now if you ever discover a way not to have a trade back up on you in trading, you will be a millionaire by the end of they year.

--- 帖子 #1696 ---
Change the code to:

If the 1 Open is greater than the MA 6 Buy. That will give you the trade you are looking for. You will find out that on a big candle move over the MA lines when it opens the next candle you will be into the trade very late and in the middle of the screen. I dont like trading in the middle of the screen.

--- 帖子 #1717 ---
The distance from top to bottom Eur/Chf is 640 gbp/chf 760. Usually gbp/chf is twice what eur/chf is normally but gbp/chf is much more volatile than the eur/chf. The eur/chf will usually have one or two big spikes a week and then do nothing the rest of the week.

--- 帖子 #1720 ---
Example of gbp/chf. If price gaps up Monday and the 6x6 cross uncrosses then the gbp/chf will become a secondary trade again. You can turn on the EA and let it enter if price drops. If price does not drop then the EA will not enter. If price gaps down then it is a no trade. If price gaps up then you probably wait until midway through the jpy session to turn the EA on. See pick below.

--- 帖子 #1724 ---
Hi Mor,

This is a little different than some threads.  Bob documents everything in the first thread and it is up to day at the very top.  I believe he puts the post and page# and then you find the post, download the attachment and go from there.

It is at V4, so download that, read the manual and you are on your way.

Another shortcut is that this is a semi-manual-auto type process.

You will only 'start' your EA's, when you visually see the conditions in which you would like to invest.  This enables entries to be a bit more painless or emotional.

Exits are handled automatically or by you.    Good process.

I got caught up in the 2nd wave of news.  It was bad...  But, I had confidence in the system (which I didn't follow to the T and if I would have would not have had the issues I did..)

This all happened in the 2nd day of live trading the system w/ only 1K or so.  But, I am almost out of it and just 'righting the ship' as Bob put it.  it was a great learning experience and that is what I wanted.

--- 帖子 #1732 ---
I took my hit on a bad trade I did.  The key is to stick to primary trades in the beginning till you get more comfortable with the system.  I got caught by the market decline (several secondary trades) where the commodity driven countries get killed as well so I had like way too may AUD pairs....

I would stick with the main pairs, do primary trades, learn it for a while, then venture out a bit.  What Bob is doing is more advanced and takes a bit of training.

If you are not comfortable with trading yet or MT4, than be especially careful and just do demo for quite a while.    This is a good system, but requires you to stick with it and it does have Martingale a bit so it can give you a little bit of emotion when you go multiple levels, but if you stick to Bob's Money Management, then you will be OK, barring a catastrophe..

Good luck!

--- 帖子 #1735 ---
MOR,

They are pretty much the same in a way.

I am doing both, the EA system (4 HOUR) and the Manual.  (live on both...)

In my opinion, I would master or at least learn the Manual system before doing any EA.  That way you UNDERSTAND what is going on and how deep of doodoo you are in and what can happen next if you let the 'drain my bank account EA' continue.

However, it can also be the 'make my account bigger EA' if you are lucky so it depends on the day.

I think the key thing to understand that in my opinion there are three very profitable and popular strategies in forex:

Trend direction systems, you can find them as usually in the first post it says, "Trend is your friend"...  They probably made a lot of money in MAY!

Ranging systems - THIS ONE....  You do good on ranging, but could get hurt when the market trends hard.  However, it does't do that as often as some would like or not like.  Example is I am working on an EA for 5M and in markets like this you make a killing....  However, in a trending market it blows up again and again...  I am up 2K on a 2K account in about 3 days trading (demo, ECN).

Breakout systems - london breakout, or anything w/ breakout...

I think they are all good and in my opinion it might not be a bad idea to do all 3.  That is where I am headed.

With Bob's system w/ 200 pip entry differences and such, it keeps you out of most of the bad stuff unless the move is ultra-big... like May...  Or October of last year or December...  Bob is smart and experienced with this management style, so do what he says and I believe you will make money.

In other words, I would stick to this if you like the 4H trading and can trade longer term.

Aloha!

--- 帖子 #1736 ---
Oh, and all your questions for setting it up will be answered if you go back and read all the posts... It is worth doing as you will see how Bob and others evolved and others have dropped out or given poor ratings.

I believe then you will find out that this is a good system.

--- 帖子 #1744 ---
You can set it to manage a magic number. So if an EA has a magic number of 5 then you set the MPTM to manage magic number 5, it is only suppose to manage those trades with the magic number of 5. This allows other EAs with different magic numbers and manual trades not to be touched. The code is set up that way but I have never tried using those features.

I have manual traded along with EA trade but my manual trades usually get into more trouble than my EA trades. I also use different types of EA. Sometimes I feel price will reverse and when it does it will go strong so I will use a 1x3. Volatile currencies I am testing a 1x10 and so far it seems to do better than a 6x6. The 1x6 is having the same problems I had with the 3x3 and that peeker trades creep in. A peeker trade enters and then price reverses on you. It just qualifies and then continues its trend. The 6x6 has fewer of those but the 1x10 looks good in testing on volatile currencies.

--- 帖子 #1745 ---
Every new type of entry point has a difficulty somewhere. Wish there was a perfect entrance but I find it makes no difference. Just try to find the one that does best and countertrade the rest. Having a limited entrance area has prevented some DD so working on that now.

No such thing as a news indicator. Best is not to trade, you cant program intelligence like, dont trade when there is news or dont trade if the next news story is going to be big. The best way to trade news is to trade only one direction. If the news goes south do only a sell. If the news goes north dont enter. Why I use a MA cross, I take a guess and if price goes against me I am not in. If it does I am in. Only way I know how to handle the news.

--- 帖子 #1748 ---
Hi BOB

Thanks for your reply. I have news for you, there is a news indicator developed in Steve Hopwood`s thread (Scooby Doo BOJ JPY pairs trading robot) the name of the indicator is ffcal.mq4 and its refinement ffcal scoobs.mq4. Basically it works by looking at FF news and filtering according to user setting of currency pairs and High, Medium and low impact news items. Steve uses this in q number of his robots. Although it is not perfect by all means it does prevent EAs from entering within a user defined parameter of x hours before and after the news.

I have no programing knowledge but knowing how much Steve respects you I am sure he can shed more light on its use if you sent him a pm.

Kind regards

--- 帖子 #1749 ---
Same thing as turning the EA on and off. You just enter the time. Regular news stories do not affect my system. It is the super news stories that happen and you dont know about them until after the fact. The last news story was all over the news but the key part was not known until several days after. IE France threatened to move out of the Euro if the rescue package was not accepted. This was not reported until several days later. This caused the market to shift significantly along with people's opinion about the package. No EA is going to help you at that time, you are already in or out of that story. When I mean a super news story I mean something like the Euro collapsing or countries pulling out. That is not part of the normal news cycle. Normal news cycle stories do not affect my 4H system. They are just part of it.

--- 帖子 #1768 ---
This is like a non automatic version of that one now. They both are based on the 6th indicator but this system filters trades by using the RWB indicator for signals to go in or out and a MA cross. The other enters automatically at certain levels. The strength of the other one is you get a lot more trades. Under normal market news stories and ranging markets it will work great. It will have trouble with long trend moves and super news stories.

This one tries to filter out the long trends and news stories by waiting for the MA cross. This system will filter out more of the bad trades but you wont get as many. What really makes this system work really well is the MPTM. I am working on version 5 now which will give you the one trade and either profit or hit the MPTM at +10. That is showing some promise. However, you still have to think and trade to use this system and too many traders want the easy way out and use an AUTO EA so they dont have to think.

Also, many of the guys here are using divergence on RSI to trade with this system and they are doing very well also. Fewer trades but much less risk.

--- 帖子 #1770 ---
It is a tricky market right now and you need to know some basic fundamentals. For example all the European currencies are weak to some degree, so matched up against each other they make good trades. GBP/CHF, EUR/GBP, EUR/CHF (I dont trade this one too slow). I would avoid any European currency with the USD unless you are going strong on the USD. I would trade minors with minors like aud/cad, aud/nzd, etc. JPY is very tricky because the Bank of Japan likes to intervene but the new PM of Japan strongly supports a weaker Yen to get exports going again so you want to trade that way. But matched up with EURO currencies really makes is a crap shoot. I am poor on fundamentals but I will stay with basics, like interest rate changes and very strong news like we have in Europe right now. Still there are trades out there and I will try to tell what I know. So tread lightly, but it is giving me ideas for version 5 that I hope will protect us in these type of markets also.

--- 帖子 #1774 ---
Guys watch this story very closely. IF this happens you do not want to be in the market.

BERLIN (MNI) - The German Constitutional Court is weighing the  possibility of imposing an interim order against Germany's participation  in the E750 billion EU/IMF fiscal rescue package, German weekly Der  Spiegel reported Sunday.

The magazine cited a letter from the President of the  Constitutional Court, Andreas Vosskuhle, to, amongst others, the German  government, the European Central Bank and the Bundesbank. The case  involves a lawsuit filed against the rescue package by Peter Gauweiler,  a lawmaker from Chancellor Angela Merkel's center-right CDU/CSU bloc.

An interim order by the court could temporarily forbid the German  government from mobilizing the loan guarantees proposed under the EU  package, Der Spiegel said. Germany's share of the EU measures amounts to  up to E148 billion in guarantees.

According to the magazine, the German government in a statement to  the Constitutional Court has warned that an interim order could lead to  "a self-fulfilling expectation of a default" by fiscally ailing EU  member states.

Moreover, the government remarked that the EU rescue package "is  not a legally binding agreement under international law but only a  political declaration of intent."

In addition to Gauweiler's lawsuit, three others have been filed at  the Constitutional Court against the rescue package. Another lawsuit is  to be filed next week, the magazine wrote.

--- 帖子 #1785 ---
Hi Nanningbob,

I recently started using the V4 system (was using the 3x3 first) which uses the MPTM. I'm demo trading with MT4 with Alpari uk and FXDD simultaneously. I notice that Alpari uk which is a 5D broker, i keeping getting the error message "jump stop function failed..." It rearly sets the jumpstop. I dont have this problem with FXDD (4D broker)I rearly get that error message. What is the reason for this?

Also, I'm trying to think of the best way of using the MPTM but I HATE how it kicks you out of a trade that may be going your way. What is the best way to trade using the MPTM?

--- 帖子 #1786 ---
The MPTM must also be set for a 5D broker also so check that first. I have demoed several companies and some will get this more than others. I have quit using the jump function and only use the BE function. I just didnt get enough to justify its usage or lots of error messages. In other words if it doesnt hit the +10 I will usually get the +50 or +100 and seldom got the inbetween.

From reading the MTPM forum I think the problem is too many messages being sent to the server at once. For example you may have one EA sending a Buy or Sell signal, The MPTM sending a BE signal and now your adding a Jump signal. If this is happening with several currencies at one time it maybe too much for the system but that is no a sure conclusion. Once the sever sends the trade context is busy or some other message back it backs up all the signals. Just my best guess on that one. Some MT4 companies servers are better than others.

I may try using several MPTM, I mean you only need a blank screen to use them. So set at one +10 @ 20, another at +25 @ 50 and so on. That may work better than the Jump function and using 1 MPTM. This way each MPTM EA is assigned one task to do instead of trying to handle several tasks on several currencies. That maybe the problem, one EA being assigned too many tasks on too many currencies.

--- 帖子 #1787 ---
"Also, I'm trying to think of the best way of using the MPTM but I HATE how it kicks you out of a trade that may be going your way...."

Again the purpose of the MTPM is to prevent a winning trade from becoming a losing trade. In other words I get some kind of profit. Since I am not home 8-12 hours a day I hated it knowing some currency pair had gone up 40 pips but when I get back home it is now -22. I rather get that +10 than deal with the negative trade that now maybe going against me. Then I may get the +10 and see it is +44 and I am out of the trade. Choose your poison.

--- 帖子 #1794 ---
I like Bob's system and trade it when I see divergence. Just thought I'd share something I've added to Bob's counter trading system to give me some trades with the trend. I figure instead of being afraid of only getting small retraces when trend is strong why not go with the flow.

Put a 200MA on a chart and look for good pinbar retracement towards the MA. Wait for good pinbars with an engulfing candle as the third candle. You can use Stoch. as a filter. Only take buys when Stoch. is coming out of OS area and sells when coming out of OB area. Chart below shows a sell setup. Trend is down, pinbar formation and Stoch. coming out of OB area.

--- 帖子 #1796 ---
Following the the trend is a very tricky proposition. It is why most traders dont make money. Every trend following system I know gets whiplashed into SL heaven. However, I think I found some places you can add some trades and they look good. Toothman had a great post on a certain trade you can look for and take. Trading anywhere in the middle of a chart someplace can be a real challenge. There are thousands of follow the trend threads here but they seldom last. There are a couple of good threads but you end up sitting at the computer all day, then you get tired, make mistakes, etc. etc. The difficulty in trading the market right now is, it is very news touchy. No matter what system you use it is a tough market to trade. Secondary trades make good money because you get bigger moves than Primary trades.

--- 帖子 #1799 ---
Bob, on hedging...

This is something I thought about doing, or have actually been doing a little of in one of my live accounts:

L1 trade entered, market continues against me for another 200 pips (.01 lots)

L2 trade entered, market continues down against me for another 100 pips (.02 lots)

S1 trade entered (hedge of L1), market continues down against me for another 100 pips (.01 lot to counter the L1 trade)

L3 trade entered at -400 pips (or whatever market says) (.04 lots)

Market retraces + 200 pips (50% fib) and I exit all positions for healthy profit.

So, my thinking I guess is if the market does continue against you, why not negate the first couple trades as they move against you more quickly.  You have probably already said this, but my thinking is to hedge 1.5 times my entries.  If the indy says to enter every 200 pips, then my hedge for that entry is 300 pips later.

If you get a big 1500 pip move like early May, than it wouldn't be nearly as bad and you don't close your trades.  You could go more levels due to less draw down and hopefully climb your way out of it...

What do you think?

--- 帖子 #1800 ---
There are several ways to control risk. Hedging is one way of doing it. Instead of extra levels you can just hedge and wait for price to come back the other way and then unhedge your trade. Or hedge your trade and use future profits to get rid of the hedge. If you 1.5 the hedge then it needs to continue to go against you for it to work. If it doesnt then you have two losing trades you need to deal with instead of one. So 1.5 works if price continues against you and doesnt if price reverses and goes against your hedge.

You cant successfully trade something that isn't defined. The reason my counter trade system is successful is I defined a counter trade and then did it. Now I am going to try to add to the counter trade system by following it after it reverses into a trend. --- 帖子 #1813 ---
If the EA is used for all the same levels all the levels will have the same magic number。So if one trade is closed the EA will then close all three. The MPTM does not close trades it just sets the SL, that is all it does. If price hits the SL then the EA will close all the trades with the same Magic number. If they are different magic numbers then they will not close. If you get into multiple levels you should take the EA off the screen then you wont have this issue. I use seperate EA crosses so each level is entered with a different magic number. That way you wont have that problem.

--- 帖子 #1818 ---
Bob nailed it.  I was having the same issue.

Long 1 EA Magic Number = 1

Long 2 EA Magic Number = 12

Long 3 EA Magic Number = 13

Short 1 EA Magic Number = 1

Short 2 EA Magic Number = 12

Short 3 EA Magic Number = 13

Set MPTM to manage by magic number, this means 3 different screens w/ MTPM for each magic number.

I really screwed up today on my live account too....

I was trying out another version and put MPTM on another MT4 instance and it goes by account, not by MT4 instance (which I didn't know) and it closed out most of my trades.    Down 1/3 of my profit for the month which isn't a whole lot as I am still testing!

Won't make that mistake again!

--- 帖子 #1846 ---
That chart looks like a transition from a downtrend to an uptrend.  If you add some moving averages you can see some crossovers to an uptrend.

I don't see the vertical signal line indicating that a sell trade should be placed, nor red bars in the NB Meter at your first entry.  There is a vertical line at the second entry and red bars on the NB Meter, but I'd be weary of the uptrend.

I guess your system mainly consists of taking the counter-trend trades.  You seem to be doing well with it. Seems more scary to me than taking the trades with the trend.  I'll need to demo it more before taking any live trades.

If you draw the fibs on the up move you can see that with a 50% retracement you can get your first loss back.  I'm not sure if there will be a 50% retracement though.

I didn't take a live EURAUD trade, I was just looking at how your system was indicating a trade.  Thanks.

--- 帖子 #1847 ---
This is a countertrend system not a trend system. I explain this in my book. The difference between a countertrend system and a trend system is: a countertrend system you are 100% guaranteed a retracement will happen. In a trend system you do not know when a trend starts, when it ends, and how long it will last. If I take a MA cross against the trend on a 4H chart I am 75-85% sure I will get 20+ pips on the move. The ones that dont I can counter trade again and take a minimum or 0 loss on the trade. The only thing I have to worry about is the super news story (NFP is not a super news story). Greece maybe going bankrupt, France threatening to pull out of the Euro are (see 1st week or May), along with interest rate changes are. So I take the trade. NZD/USD mystifies me as to why I got that first level. Must have been drinking too much green tea.

--- 帖子 #1848 ---
I am not a Fib guy, I think that is a worthless indicator. If you put it on the chart less than 10% of the time price will  bounce or hit a Fib line. In truth almost all Fib lines are only hit when the also correspond with a S/R line. So in  my opinion S/R lines are far superior over Fib lines. I once changed the math on the Fib lines and found out that no matter what math I used for the 4 lines between the top and bottom (0-100), price would hit a line about 10% of the time. So I threw that indicator into the trash.

--- 帖子 #1852 ---
I've had much better success rate with fibs myself. My mentor is astonishing with them, often with projections and retracements to the pip, and over 80%, maybe over 90%, close to the levels. He took a training course under DiNapoli himself. But you don't need to hit to the pip exactly, close is good enough to know where to be looking to close half or all the position.

You're right about not knowing where trends start. Once the retracement happens though you know where the trend started, where the retracement is, and then you can get into the trend after the retracement ends. Easy to draw the fibs with these points known and you get the profit target. This method is often used by my mentor, but I haven't gotten the hang of it during live trading. I still try to get into the trend where it starts, hard to do. Maybe his method is the corollary of your method.

You say that you don't know where the trend will end. Do you know where the retracement will end? How do you set the profit targets?

--- 帖子 #1855 ---
The penultimate sentence in your post is the most important aspect of your system distinguishing it from any other I have seen. I have not come across any other system where a plan is in place to deal with losing trades. Normally in any system losing trades are accepted as part of trading but here there is a specific and detailed course of action to deal with it. As long as the trader has good money management discipline (i.e. stick to lots of 1/200,000 or 1/500,000 x account balance for example if your account balance is $5,000 divide by 200,000 = 0.02 lots) and LIMIT number of trades, everything will go smoothly.

Bob being an expert can handle a large number of trades being open at the same time, however, what I have found is that if I have more than 8 or 10 trades open at one time and they go in DD then keeping up with level 2 and 3 trades for recovery can become a bit of a hand full. I will keep only 8 to 10  trades open at one time till such time I am more confident. Finally, I am still not 100% used to the mentality of H4 trading. It takes a bit of time to get used to having some trades open for couple of weeks and -ve trades of few hundred pips!

--- 帖子 #1858 ---
Sorry to disappoint you guy but the big traders use S/R lines, that is why every broker lists S/R lines every day not Fib lines. Fibonacci was an Italian mathematician who designed a math formula. The math formula has nothing to do with trading, stocks, Forex or anything else, it is a math formula. If you draw any 4 random lines on the screen an x amount of the lines are going to lines up with an x amount of candles. It is just the odds of it happening.  It is not S/R lines line up with Fib lines it is the other way around. S/R lines have existed as long as trading has existed. Fibs are just a fad right now. The bottom line is Fibs only work when they line up with S/R lines and that is a happen stance. Again Fib traders dont show when it doesnt work which is very very often. I studied Fib lines and it has an accuracy rate of about 10%, I am not going to bother with them because they are a worthless trading tool. When you look at using something you look at it from all the time not at only when it works and Fibs will fail you the vast majority of the time.

--- 帖子 #1862 ---
The plan for dealing with losing trades is normally a stop loss. And for what seems like a typical profit target of 25 pips (from Bob's results listings), the stop loss should not be more than 10 or 15 pips. That is kind of tight for a 4 hour chart, but the profit target is also kind of small for a 4 hour chart too, more like a profit target of a 15 minute chart, maybe even for a 5 minute chart if you limit the trades to only the best setups.

Why are stop losses not used in this plan? Seems like a personal hang-up about having a losing trade. This is typical for professionals like doctors, dentists and engineers, since in their professions making a mistake has dire consequences. They carry this into their trading and think a losing trade is a mistake that they cannot make. They end up blowing up their accounts and are the worst traders, as a rule. However, the truth is you only need to be right 50% or less to make money in forex.

In Bob's document he shows a trade that went wrong in L1 by 200 pips, then wrong again in L2 by 200 pips, but then with a reverse martingale strategy makes it back to even in L3 with 133 pips (a stated one third retracement of the 400 pips, or maybe the 38.2 fib level, haha).

What would have happened in this scenario with stop losses? Hard to say what the profit targets would have been. The typical profit target of 25 pips he shows in the results seems low, especially since he is expecting to get 133 pips in the last trade to make the recovery work. Anyway, say he was using 60 pips stop loss each time (10 is usually too low for a 4 hour chart, though it may work once in a while). So in the end it would be -60, -60 and +133. Even without using the reverse martingale strategy (a betting or gambling strategy) he would have been farther ahead using stop losses.

You may notice that even with only a winning percentage of 33%, there would still be a profit after 3 trades. It doesn't make sense to be chasing after 25 pips profit targets with 60 pip stop losses though. The alternative of possibly being hundreds of pips in the hole only works with pocket change pips, unless you have very deep pockets.

--- 帖子 #1863 ---
Black,

This is the way I trade this system and the way I look at it.

This is not 'typical' type system and you have to change the  mindset to understand it.  It is more about money management than about good entries.  With my futures trading, I have a 5 tick stop (50.00) and my TP's are usually 20, 30, 40, or even 200 ticks away dependent upon how lucky I am!  This is where a tight stop is used and with a distant TP makes lots of sense when you make lots of losses, but 1 winner pays for them in spades.  BUT, I am absolutely glued to my charts by the tick for 1 hour per day (NY OPEN) and it takes immense concentration and one can only do that for so long in one day before going f-in crazy.

With this system (NB), you basically have a bunch of little tiny winners (20 pips, etc..) and some losers or DD (-500 pips etc..) which you then use Martingale to get you out of it.  This doesn't take you being glued to the screen or trying to have to figure out EXACTLY where the pivot is, or most likely where you are probably wrong.

Very few moves are greater than 2000 pips, so, if you are entering LONG on the bottom of your screen, and it drops, you have a long ways to play with it to get back to 0.  If you trade smaller time frames, then not possible and a big move will wipe you out.

I love this concept as the brokers can't stop you from picking up hundreds of 10 to 20 to 30 pip wins while YES, you have drawdown and your L2, L3, etc. will get you out of that.

An example would be:

USDCAD

L1 trades = 13 different trades at +20 pips, before it hits DD and you need an L2 trade at 220 pips down the road.  If that L2 comes up and gets you back to 0+, then I rinse and repeat.

You trade very small contract amounts so 500 pips is really like 15 pips on a 15 minute chart etc..

I love it because no screwing around w/ the HOUSE (broker).

However, what Bob advocates in his 2-4-2 recovery is not martingale and he emphasizes that fact. You do not need to use the recovery if you wish, it is optional. Mind you this is one of very few systems which offers a strategy to deal with losses. This system is very flexible and does encourage traders own development and evolution.

Another way of dealing with losses is the use of hedge, however, since the silly NFA rules BOB has not talked about this much. What should be remembered is the universal truth that within a large price movement of 800 to 1000 pips there are always retraces of at last 200 pips. But again it is up to the traders feeling. You can close and accept the loss, hedge or use 2-4-2 recovery it is up to you.

--- 帖子 #1883 ---
One of the reasons I post my ideas is to encourage innovation. Having said that all trading EAs are based on indicators and they all have one main problem. It is what I call the peeker trade, in other words no matter what you use as your qualifications there is always those small handful of trades that qualify and then price reverses. This happens in trend following EAs a lot and to a lesser extent my counter trade system. I am having this same problem all week with my trend following EA. A trade will qualify and then reverse fields. I already know whatever you come up with will have peeker trades happen. This means we dont try but that is the problem that needs to be solved. Solve that one problem and your a millionaire. Now there are several ways to handle these.

1. Take a SL (most common approach, death slowly by SL, the tighter the SL the more often it is hit. The wider the less often.)

2. Multi-level trade ( IE reenter at another position and zero out the negative trade but have rules to limit your losses if you cant)

3. Martingale ( keep adding until you win or wipe out your account)

4. Hedge (come back another day, week, or month and trade under your conditions not the markets) Right now I dont have a set a rules for this but am working on it.

--- 帖子 #1884 ---
Let me give you a lesson on indicators. All indicators are based on moving averages, you need to understand this to know their limits, weaknesses and strengths. For instance you take any major indicator in your MT4 system and all they do is take a moving average and post it on your screen using lines or in the case of Haiken Ashi, it uses bars instead of lines. Ichimoku uses MA and plots them into the future and then draws cute little clouds of different colors on your screen. All it is doing is plotting previous S/R lines based on certain MAs and moving them into the future. Neat little system but still a MA system. Some use separate charts like MACD and Stochastics etc. and they will draw lines or bars. Some systems use math formulas off of highs and lows and then draw lines. Pivot point systems do this along with Fib and the 6ths indicator I use. Pivot point system uses the previous days high and the low and the middle is your pivot. Then it uses math formulas to draw lines above and below the pivot. It changes every day. Fibs uses the last previous high and low from longer period time frame to draw lines on a screen. These lines are based on a percentage from the high and low or a moving average of the high/low plus a math formula and freezes it in time. The difference between a MA line and pivots and fibs are pivots, Fibs, etc. are MAs frozen in time based on previous highs and lows and some Math formula and MA lines keep moving with price and time. People keep coming up with new indicators but they dont realize they will all have the same flaws. MA no matter how you design them only tell you what has been happening. They can never predict the future so when you commit to any indicator there is always a chance price will not do what it has been doing and will suddenly reverse at or near your entrance point. No indicator can ever solve this problem. Every once in a while someone will come onto my threads and say if you just use indicator A or B or C this will solve your problem. No it wont because I know your indicator is based on some form of MA and all MA have the same weaknesses and strengths. The problems will just pop up at some different point than some other indicator.

So I have come to one conclusion concerning Forex trading. What goes up must come down and what goes down must come up. That truth is always 100% true. If we apply some common sense rules and not get overly committed to any trade or group of trades we can wait out the market for its reversals and counter rallies and counter dips. These will always happen and we can profit by them. That in a nutshell is my philosophy behind all my systems. You can change indicators and adjust them but they do not know whether price will go up/down 50, 100, 200 or 500 pips the next minute, hour, day, or week. I only know that when they do reverse they will come back down/up again and I make money or break even. That is my philosophy. The only thing I need to fear is the super news stories and interest rate changes. (NFP, news spikes, etc. are not super news stories).

--- 帖子 #1885 ---
I know I said I would try to get my new idea out this weekend but there is no way. Again the peeker trades are haunting the trend following system, the bugaboo of all trend trading systems. You just dont know when the trend is over or going to continue, the peeker trade enters during this transition period and it is a matter of when do I cut this loss. You cant 2.4.2 your way out because the peeker trade will be at the very bottom/top of the trend so you cant outlast being at the beginning of a new trend going the other way. The trend trading part seems to work fine, its figuring out how to deal with transition. That may take some time. I thought I had a solution but it has peeker trades that are just in a very bad spot.

--- 帖子 #1888 ---
Bob,

Good point.  I am somewhat new to FOREX, but have been trading FUTURES for quite a bit longer.  I was not profitable in FUTURES until I actually mastered the underlying instrument and how it 'danced' or 'sung' without the indicators occasionally wasting my time.  I found out over time, that tune or move changed considerably and I just had to adjust and keep in line, kind of like dancing to a new partner.

I have been working on a double grid system and I think I have come to the conclusion that a Martingale system no matter what only works if you have a lot of cash on very little leverage and hence your returns become nominal.

I have almost killed it for now.  However, I took you EA (from other thread) and added stop gap trailing and a trailing stop embedded in the code and it works reasonably well.  But, you still get into those death spins and the key would be to stay out of it, but how do you know how far and long the drop will be.  My trading in Futures is I get in, I am out in 15 minutes max with some serious ticks, OR, I am out right away with a small loss so completely different mindset...

Just thought I would share.  I will also post my new EA with changes in the other thread to see if anyone has any interest.  I had to dig out of my brain my old crappy programming skills.

Oh, and there is an interesting anti-grid trend following system that 7-bit is doing that could help your trend system maybe...    It is in the platform area and I think it is called snowball.  I have actually come up with the same idea, but mine adds positions off of bar closes instead of so many pips...

--- 帖子 #1893 ---
How do we ever solve this riddle?

Trend EAs suffer in ranging periods and martingales in long trends. As we go towards higher TF may be we postpone that rogue trade happening but when it happens it will cause equally higher damage.

May be we look at a middle range TF say H1 or M30, enter as many boring pairs with a smaller TP and Pips and close trades at the end of the day, whatever happens. Have a fixed target for either profit or loss.

Sixth EA has lot of promise according to me even on lower TFs like M30 or H1.

--- 帖子 #1894 ---
The lower the TF the higher the percentage of whiplash. I originally started with my RWB lines on lower TF and I would get killed at time. It did not become profitable until the 4H TF. The problem I have seen with every trend following program has been whiplash. Like this morning with the gaps. Bunch of news traders went out and bought commodity currencies but that pushes the price of their goods up and makes them less affordable. In a recession time that is not good for them. People cant buy right now until they get their jobs back. So the Yuan story, I believe will have short legs for now.

--- 帖子 #1895 ---
IMHO this counter trend system is the way to go. The reason I find the concept of Volume Spread Analysis appealing is due to its explanation of price jumps and trends, claiming that by the time ordinary folks jump on the trend band  wagon (the concept of HERD mentality)the Smart money is already disposing their holdings.

Although as mentioned before the vast majority of forex traders do not think that volume can be accurately gauged in forex. I am not sure but keeping an open mind for the time being. I do not think we should discuss this concept here since there are plenty of threads where you can see the arguments for and against it.

The areas where NB H4 can be improved is mainly money management and entry. At present we do not have clear rules as to when to exit a non profitable trade and this is very much open to individual trader`s discretion. Maybe we should have a clear set of guide lines as to when a -ve trade should go into recovery using 2-4-2 and when we should just take the loss and move on.

If you ever wanted a rationale for being counter trend trader this is it. For people  who do not have time here is the last paragraph: QUOTE:"Summary: 60-80% of volume in the markets is professional activity. 90% of traders lose money. 90% of weak money buy tops and sell bottoms. 10% of traders sell tops and buy bottoms. Why so many people are focusing on and copying what majority or 90% of traders are doing and miss the fact that if something is very obvious in the market, it is obviously wrong."

--- 帖子 #1904 ---
Hi Bob, sorry that I have to resurface this up again after so long. Been thinking about it and it simply doesn't make sense. If i'm using a 5 decimal system, (g 1.23003) a pip movement would be equilvalent to 0.00001 whereas in a 4 decimal system a pip would be 0.0001.

So the difference of 1 pip in a 4 and 5 decimal system is a tenth.

4 decimal 25pip?

5decimal 250pips?

--- 帖子 #1905 ---

--- 帖子 #1906 ---

--- 帖子 #1907 ---
I think I am the most vocal disciple and enthusiastic advocate of your system. The system does not need changing since it has proven itself over and over. If I have had losses it is because I have not adhered to the rules or I missed something in the instructions. It would be crazy to change something which is working as it should. Having said that it does not mean that further improvements and fine tuning is not needed.

At present we rely on mathematical indicators to identify OS and OB conditions for our entry and exit rules. IMHO a further aid in determining change of the trend direction and retraces would increase profitability and reduction of losing trades. using additional mathematical indicators (e.g. Schaff, Aroon, RSX, W%R, etc) is just a duplication of WBR indicator which is already used. I am not familiar enough with Volume spread analysis in forex to make a definite judgment, however, there seem to be a large number of people who use this method in their trading with +ve results. I do not want to overload the thread with large volume of materials, therefore, I will post short articles that may shed more light on the concept.

--- 帖子 #1908 ---
Sorry guys a pip is a pip adding a decimal place does not change a pip but just adds a tenth place to it. 25 pips in 4 decimals is 25.0 in five decimals. Macman definition is the best 250 pipettes equals 25 pips. LOL love it. In my opinion the 5th decimal is just garbage advertising, you think your getting some kind of fraction value but it allows brokers to expand the spread for a split second at the time of trade, either open or close, but advertise we hold this spread 99.9% of the time. It is gimmick advertising when the program can enlarge the spread for a split second open/close the trade and then go back to the low spread again. Your still paying the higher spreads. It is why the MPTM is getting a lot of trade context is busy signals and you have to wait several seconds and sometimes minutes to get your SL moved up. The constant moving around the spread is qualifying and unqualifying the signal. Nice move on their part to stop or slow down these more advanced EA systems.
